cfabort.name: cfabort
cfabort.help: Stops the processing of a CFML page at the tag location. CFML returns everything that was processed before the tag. The tag is often used with conditional logic to stop processing a page when a condition occurs.

showerror.name: showerror
showerror.help: Error to display, in a standard CFML error page, when tag executes

cfapplet (appletsource).name: cfapplet
cfapplet (appletsource).help: This tag references a registered custom Java applet. To register a Java applet, in the CFML Administrator, click Extensions/Java Applets. Using this tag within a cfform tag is optional. If you use it within cfform, and the method attribute is defined in the Administrator, the return value is incorporated into the form.

name.name: name
name.help: Form variable name for applet

height.name: height
height.help: Control's height, in pixels.

width.name: width
width.help: Control's width, in pixels.

vspace.name: vspace
vspace.help: Vertical margin above and below control, in pixels.

hspace.name: hspace
hspace.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of control, in pixels.

notsupported.name: notsupported
notsupported.help: Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.
notsupported.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

cfapplet (name).name: cfapplet
cfapplet (name).help: This tag references a registered custom Java applet. To register a Java applet, in the CFML Administrator, click Extensions/Java Applets. Using this tag within a cfform tag is optional. If you use it within cfform, and the method attribute is defined in the Administrator, the return value is incorporated into the form.

name.name: name
name.help: Form variable name for applet

height.name: height
height.help: Control's height, in pixels.

width.name: width
width.help: Control's width, in pixels.

vspace.name: vspace
vspace.help: Vertical margin above and below control, in pixels.

hspace.name: hspace
hspace.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of control, in pixels.

notsupported.name: notsupported
notsupported.help: Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.
notsupported.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

cfapplet.name: cfapplet
cfapplet.help: This tag references a registered custom Java applet. To register a Java applet, in the CFML Administrator, click Extensions/Java Applets. Using this tag within a cfform tag is optional. If you use it within cfform, and the method attribute is defined in the Administrator, the return value is incorporated into the form.

name.name: name
name.help: Form variable name for applet

height.name: height
height.help: Control's height, in pixels.

width.name: width
width.help: Control's width, in pixels.

vspace.name: vspace
vspace.help: Vertical margin above and below control, in pixels.

hspace.name: hspace
hspace.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of control, in pixels.

notsupported.name: notsupported
notsupported.help: Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.
notsupported.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

cfapplication.name: cfapplication
cfapplication.help: Defines the scope of a CFML application; enables and disables storage of Client variables; specifies the Client variable storage mechanism; enables Session variables; and sets Application variable timeouts.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of application. Up to 64 characters

loginstorage.name: loginstorage
loginstorage.help: cookie: store login information in the Cookie scope. session: store login information in the Session scope.

clientstorage.name: clientstorage
clientstorage.help: How client variables are stored * datasource_name: in ODBC or native data source. You must create storage repository in the Administrator. * registry: in the system registry. * cookie: on client computer in a cookie. Scalable. If client disables cookies in the browser, client variables do not work

setclientcookies.name: setclientcookies
setclientcookies.help: No: CFML does not automatically send CFID and CFTOKEN cookies to client browser; you must manually code CFID and CFTOKEN on the URL for every page that uses Session or Client variables

sessiontimeout.name: sessiontimeout
sessiontimeout.help: Lifespan of session variables. CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas

applicationtimeout.name: applicationtimeout
applicationtimeout.help: Lifespan of application variables. CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas.

setdomaincookies.name: setdomaincookies
setdomaincookies.help: Yes: Sets CFID and CFTOKEN cookies for a domain (not a host) Required, for applications running on clusters.

scriptprotect.name: scriptprotect
scriptprotect.help: Specifies whether to protect variables from cross-site scripting attacks. - none: do not protect variables - all: protect Form, URL, CGI, and Cookie variables - comma-delimited list of ColdFusion scopes: protect variables in the specified scopes

securejsonprefix.name: securejsonprefix
securejsonprefix.help: The security prefix to put in front of the value that a ColdFusion function returns in JSON-format 				in response to a remote call if the secureJSON setting is true.

securejson.name: securejson
securejson.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to add a security prefix in front of any value that a ColdFusion function returns in JSON-format 				 in response to a remote call.

serverSideFormValidation.name: serverSideFormValidation
serverSideFormValidation.help: Enable/Disable ColdFusion’s server side validation on CFFORM.

datasource.name: datasource
datasource.help: Name of the data source from which the query retrieves data.

exchangeserverversion.name: exchangeserverversion
exchangeserverversion.help: Default version of the Microsoft Exchange Server for cfexchange tags.

authcookie.name: authcookie
authcookie.help: Struct that contains authentication cookie attributes used in cflogin tag

sessioncookie.name: sessioncookie
sessioncookie.help: Struct that contains session cookie attributes

wsversion.name: wsversion
wsversion.help: Axis version to be used when generating WebService stubs

cfargument.name: cfargument
cfargument.help: Creates a parameter definition within a component definition. Defines a function argument. Used within a cffunction tag.

name.name: name
name.help: An argument name.

type.name: type
type.help: A type name; data type of the argument.

required.name: required
required.help: Whether the parameter is required to execute the component method.

default.name: default
default.help: If no argument is passed, specifies a default argument value.

displayname.name: displayname
displayname.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. A value to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC.

hint.name: hint
hint.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The hint attribute value follows the displayname attribute value in the parameter description line. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter

restargsource.name: restargsource
restargsource.help: Extracts request parameters in a REST request. Request can be passed in the path, query, matrix, cookie, and form

restargname.name: restargname
restargname.help: The name that can be mapped to the argument name.If restArgName is not specified, the name of the argument is used to extract the parameter value

cfassociate.name: cfassociate
cfassociate.help: Allows subtag data to be saved with a base tag. Applies only to custom tags.

datacollection.name: datacollection
datacollection.help: Structure in which base tag stores subtag data

cfbreak.name: cfbreak
cfbreak.help: Used within a cfloop tag. Breaks out of a loop.

cfcache.name: cfcache
cfcache.help: Stores a copy of a page on the server and/or client computer, to improve page rendering performance. To do this, the tag creates temporary files that contain the static HTML returned from a CFML page.  Use this tag if it is not necessary to get dynamic content each time a user accesses a page. You can use this tag for simple URLs and for URLs that contain URL parameters.

action.name: action
action.help: * cache: server-side and client-side caching. * flush: refresh cached page(s). * clientcache: browser-side caching only. To cache a personalized page, use this option. * servercache: server-side caching only. Not recommended. * optimal: same as "cache".

timespan.name: timespan
timespan.help: The interval until the page is flushed from the cache.

expireurl.name: expireurl
expireurl.help: Used with action = "flush". A URL reference. CFML matches it against the mappings in the specified cache directory. Can include wildcards. For example: "*/view.cfm?id=*".

username.name: username
username.help: A username

password.name: password
password.help: A password

port.name: port
port.help: Remote port to which to connect

protocol.name: protocol
protocol.help: Protocol that is used to create URL from cache.

value.name: value
value.help: For action="set", object which needs to be stored

throwonerror.name: throwonerror
throwonerror.help: A Boolean value specifying whether t throw an error if the flush action encounters an error. Otherwise the action does not generate an error if it fails. If this attribute is true you can handle the error in a cfcatch block, for example, if a specified id value is invalid

usecache.name: usecache
usecache.help: To use cache or not (if false it will process the content each time)

dependson.name: dependson
dependson.help: Comma seperated list of all variables on which this cache would depend

idletime.name: idletime
idletime.help: Flushes the cached item if it is not accessed for the specified time span.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of return variable, valid with action="get"

useQueryString.name: useQueryString
useQueryString.help: If true, generates a template cache ID that includes the query string. This means, that a new template cahce is created whenever the query string changes. If set to true, the attribute dependson considers the URL parameters defined in the querystring as well to generate template caches.

cfcalendar.name: cfcalendar
cfcalendar.help: Puts an interactive Macromedia Flash format calendar in an HTML or Flash form. Not supported in XML format forms. The calendar lets a user select a date for submission as a form variable.

name.name: name
name.help: The name of the calendar.

height.name: height
height.help: The vertical dimension of the calendar specified in pixels.

width.name: width
width.help: The horizontal dimension of the calendar specified in pixels.

selecteddate.name: selecteddate
selecteddate.help: The date that is initially selected. It is highlighted in a color determined by the form skin. Must be in mm/dd/yyyy or dd/mm/yyyy format, depending on the current locale. (Use the setlocale tag to set the locale, if necessary.)

startrange.name: startrange
startrange.help: The start of a range of dates that are disabled. Users cannot select dates from this date through the date specified by the endRange attribute.

endrange.name: endrange
endrange.help: The end of a range of dates that are disabled. Users cannot select dates from the date specified by the startRange attribute through this date.

disabled.name: disabled
disabled.help: Disables all user input, making the control read only. To disable input, specify disabled without an attribute or disabled="true". To enable input, omit the attribute or specify disabled="false". Default is: false

mask.name: mask
mask.help: A pattern that specifies the format of the submitted date. Mask characters are: - D = day, can use 0-2 mask characters - M = month, can use 0-4 mask characters - Y = year, can use 0, 2, or 4 characters - E = day in week, can use 0-4 characters - Any other character = put the character in the specified location Default is: MM/DD/YYYY

firstdayofweek.name: firstdayofweek
firstdayofweek.help: Integer in the range 0-6 specifying the first day of the week in the calendar, 0 indicates Sunday, 6 indicates Saturday. Default is: 0

daynames.name: daynames
daynames.help: A comma-delimited list that sets the names of the weekdays displayed in the calendar. Sunday is the first day and the rest of the weekday names follow in the normal order. Default is: S,M,T,W,Th,F,S

monthnames.name: monthnames
monthnames.help: A comma-delimited list of the month names that are displayed at the top of the calendar.

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.help: Flash only: Specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. This is the inverse of the disabled attribute.

visible.name: visible
visible.help: Flash only: Specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank.

tooltip.name: tooltip
tooltip.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

style.name: style
style.help: Flash only: Actionscript style or styles to apply to the calendar. Default is: haloGreen

onchange.name: onchange
onchange.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the user selects a date.

onblur.name: onblur
onblur.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the user selects a date.

onfocus.name: onfocus
onfocus.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the user selects a date.

cfcase (value).name: cfcase
cfcase (value).help: Used only inside the cfswitch tag body. Contains code to execute when the expression specified in the cfswitch tag has one or more specific values.

value.name: value
value.help: The value or values that the expression attribute of the cfswitch tag must match. To specify multiple matching values, separate the values with the delimiter character. The value or values must be simple constants or constant expressions, not variables.

delimiters.name: delimiters
delimiters.help: Specifies the delimiter character or characters that separate multiple values to match. If you specify multiple delimiter characters, you can use any of them to separate the values to be matched.

cfcase.name: cfcase
cfcase.help: Used only inside the cfswitch tag body. Contains code to execute when the expression specified in the cfswitch tag has one or more specific values.

value.name: value
value.help: The value or values that the expression attribute of the cfswitch tag must match. To specify multiple matching values, separate the values with the delimiter character. The value or values must be simple constants or constant expressions, not variables.

delimiters.name: delimiters
delimiters.help: Specifies the delimiter character or characters that separate multiple values to match. If you specify multiple delimiter characters, you can use any of them to separate the values to be matched.

cfcatch.name: cfcatch
cfcatch.help: Used inside a cftry tag. Together, they catch and process exceptions in CFML pages. Exceptions are events that disrupt the normal flow of instructions in a CFML page, such as failed database operations, missing include files, and developer-specified events.

type.name: type
type.help: *  application: catches application exceptions * database: catches database exceptions * template: catches ColdFusion page exceptions * security: catches security exceptions * object: catches object exceptions * missingInclude: catches missing include file exceptions * expression: catches expression exceptions * lock: catches lock exceptions * custom_type: catches the specified custom exception type that is defined in a cfthrow tag * searchengine: catches Solr search engine exceptions * any: catches all exception types

name.name: name
name.help: Variable name for cfcatch exception

chartheight.name: chartheight
chartheight.help: Chart height; integer number of pixels

chartwidth.name: chartwidth
chartwidth.help: Chart width; integer number of pixels

gridlines.name: gridlines
gridlines.help: Number of grid lines to display on value axis, including axis; positive integer.

seriesplacement.name: seriesplacement
seriesplacement.help: Applies to charts that have more than one data series. Relative positions of series.

foregroundcolor.name: foregroundcolor
foregroundcolor.help: Color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

backgroundcolor.name: backgroundcolor
backgroundcolor.help: Color of the area between the data background and the chart border, around labels and around the legend. Hexadecimal value or supported named color. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

showborder.name: showborder
showborder.help: Whether to display a border around the chart

databackgroundcolor.name: databackgroundcolor
databackgroundcolor.help: Color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

fontitalic.name: fontitalic
fontitalic.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

fontbold.name: fontbold
fontbold.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

xaxistype.name: xaxistype
xaxistype.help: * category The axis indicates the data category. Data is sorted according to the sortXAxis attribute. * scale The axis is numeric. All cfchartdata item attribute values must numeric. The X axis is automatically sorted numerically.

yaxistype.name: yaxistype
yaxistype.help: Currently has no effect, as Y axis is always used for data values. Valid values are category and scale

sortxaxis.name: sortxaxis
sortxaxis.help: Display column labels in alphabetic order along X-axis. Ignored if the xAxisType attribute is scale.

xoffset.name: xoffset
xoffset.help: Applies if show3D="yes". Number of units by which to display the chart as angled, horizontally

yoffset.name: yoffset
yoffset.help: Applies if show3D="yes". Number of units by which to display the chart as angled, horizontally.

showlegend.name: showlegend
showlegend.help: yes: if chart contains more than one data series, display legend

tipstyle.name: tipstyle
tipstyle.help: Determines the action that opens a popup window to display information about the current chart element. * mouseDown: display if the user positions the cursor at the element and clicks the mouse. Applies only to Flash format graph files. * mouseOver: displays if the user positions the cursor at the element * none: suppresses display

tipbgcolor.name: tipbgcolor
tipbgcolor.help: Color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

showmarkers.name: showmarkers
showmarkers.help: Applies to chartseries type attribute values line, curve and scatter. yes: display markers at data points

markersize.name: markersize
markersize.help: Size of data point marker. in pixels. Integer.

pieslicestyle.name: pieslicestyle
pieslicestyle.help: Applies to chartseries type attribute value pie.

URL.name: URL
URL.help: URL to open if the user clicks item in a data series; the onClick destination page.  You can specify variables within the URL string; ColdFusion passes current values of the variables. * $VALUE$: the value of the selected row. If none, the value is an empty string. * $ITEMLABEL$: the label of the selected item. If none, the value is an empty string. * $SERIESLABEL$: the label of the selected series. If none, the value is an empty string.

name.name: name
name.help: Page variable name. String. Generates the the graph as binary data and assigns it to the specified variable. Suppresses chart display. You can use the name value in the cffile tag to write the chart to a file.

style.name: style
style.help: XML file or string to use to specify the style of the chart.

arrows.name: arrows
arrows.help: Creates arrows to indicate chart data

height.name: height
height.help: Height of the chart in pixels. Default is 240

labels.name: labels
labels.help: Displays custom text/images on the chart

plot.name: plot
plot.help: Globally customizes styling and chart series features

preview.name: preview
preview.help: Struct that contains style attributes of the preview area, including zoom controls

scales.name: scales
scales.help: Specifies scales a dataset should be plotted against.

type.name: type
type.help: Tooltip styles for the chart

xaxis2.name: xaxis2
xaxis2.help: Details for the second X Axis (at the top of the chart)

yaxis2.name: yaxis2
yaxis2.help: Details for the second Y Axis (to the right of the chart)

width.name: width
width.help: Chart width in pixels

bevel.name: bevel
bevel.help: Indicates if bevel properties be displayed. Could be Boolean or Struct

refresh.name: refresh
refresh.help: Refresh interval and feed URL etc. for the chart

query.name: query
query.help: Name of CFML query from which to get data.

cfchartdata.name: cfchartdata
cfchartdata.help: Used with the cfchart and cfchartseries tags. This tag defines chart data points. Data is submitted to the cfchartseries tag.

value.name: value
value.help: Value of the data point. Could be an expression or a number

cfchartseries.name: cfchartseries
cfchartseries.help: Used with the cfchart tag. This tag defines the style in which chart data displays: bar, line, pie, and so on.

type.name: type
type.help: Sets the chart display style

query.name: query
query.help: Name of CFML query from which to get data.

itemcolumn.name: itemcolumn
itemcolumn.help: Name of a column in the query specified in the query attribute; contains the item label for a data point to graph.

valuecolumn.name: valuecolumn
valuecolumn.help: Name of a column in the query specified in the query attribute; contains data values to graph.

paintstyle.name: paintstyle
paintstyle.help: Sets the paint display style of the data series.

colorlist.name: colorlist
colorlist.help: Applies if chartseries type attribute = "pie". Sets pie slice colors.  Comma-delimited list of hex values or supported, named web colors.  For a hex value, use the form "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two pound signs or none.

datalabelstyle.name: datalabelstyle
datalabelstyle.help: Specifies the way in which the color is applied to the item in the series: - None = nothing is printed (default) - Value = the value of the datapoint - Rowlabel = the row's label - Columnlabel = the column's label - Pattern

alpha.name: alpha
alpha.help: Defines the opacity of the graph background color

bevel.name: bevel
bevel.help: Indicates if bevel properties to be displayed. Could be Boolean or Struct

data.name: data
data.help: Data as Array of Arrays. If specified, cfchartdata cannot be used

scales.name: scales
scales.help: Comma-separated axis against which to plot the series

shadow.name: shadow
shadow.help: Indicates if shadow to be displayed. Could be Boolean or Struct

seriescolor.name: seriescolor
seriescolor.help: Color of the main element (such as bars) of a chart. For a pie chart, the color of the first slice.  Hex value or supported named color. For a hex value, use the form "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two pound signs or none.

cfcol (text).name: cfcol
cfcol (text).help: Defines table column header, width, alignment, and text. Used within a cftable tag.

header.name: header
header.help: Column header text. To use this attribute, you must also use the cftable colHeaders attribute.

width.name: width
width.help: Column width. If the length of data displayed exceeds this value, data is truncated. To avoid this, use an HTML table tag.

text.name: text
text.help: Double-quotation mark-delimited text; determines what to display. Rules: same as for cfoutput sections. You can embed hyperlinks, image references, and input controls

cfcol.name: cfcol
cfcol.help: Defines table column header, width, alignment, and text. Used within a cftable tag.

header.name: header
header.help: Column header text. To use this attribute, you must also use the cftable colHeaders attribute.

width.name: width
width.help: Column width. If the length of data displayed exceeds this value, data is truncated. To avoid this, use an HTML table tag.

text.name: text
text.help: Double-quotation mark-delimited text; determines what to display. Rules: same as for cfoutput sections. You can embed hyperlinks, image references, and input controls

cfcollection.name: cfcollection
cfcollection.help: Creates, registers, and administers Solr search engine collections.  A collection that is created with the cfcollection tag is internal. A collection created any other way is external.

action.name: action
action.help: categorylist: retrieves categories from the collection and indicates how many documents are in each one. Returns a structure of structures in which the category representing each substructure is associated with a number of documents. For a category in a category tree, the number of documents is the number at or below that level in the tree. create: registers the collection with CFML. - If the collection is present: creates a map to it - If the collection is not present: creates it delete: unregisters a collection. - If the collection was registered with action = create: deletes its directories - If the collection was registered and mapped: does not delete collection directories optimize: optimizes the structure and contents of the collection for searching; recovers space. list: returns a query result set, named from the name attribute value, of the attributes of the collections that are registered by CF Server.

collection.name: collection
collection.help: A collection name. The name can include spaces

path.name: path
path.help: Absolute path to a SOLR collection.

name.name: name
name.help: Name for the query results returned by the list action.

categories.name: categories
categories.help: Used only for creating a collection: - true: This collection includes support for categories. - false: This collection does not support categories. Default.

cfcomponent.name: cfcomponent
cfcomponent.help: Creates and defines a component object; encloses functionality that you build in CFML and enclose within cffunction tags. This tag contains one or more cffunction tags that define methods. Code within the body of this tag, other than cffunction tags, is executed when the component is instantiated.

extends.name: extends
extends.help: Name of parent component from which to inherit methods and properties.

initmethod.name: initmethod
initmethod.help: Method that will be called when ColdFusion instantiates the component

implements.name: implements
implements.help: Name of the ColdFusion interface or interfaces that this component implements. If the component implements an interface, it must define all the functions in the interface, and the function definitions must conform to the definitions specified in the interface. For more information, see cfinterface. A component can implement any number of interfaces. To specify multiple interface, use a comma delimited list, of the format interface1,interface2.

output.name: output
output.help: Specifies whether constructor code in the component can generate HTML output; does not affect output in the body of cffunction tags in the component.

displayname.name: displayname
displayname.help: A string to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The information appears on the heading, following the component name. If the style attribute is set to document, the displayname attribute is used as the name of the service element in the WSDL.

hint.name: hint
hint.help: Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The hint attribute value appears below the component name heading. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter. If the style attribute is set to document, the hint attribute is used as the document element of the service in the WSDL.

style.name: style
style.help: Specifies whether a CFC used for web services uses RPC-encoded style or document-literal style: - rpc: RPC-encoded style, default - document: Document-literal style If you specify document, you must also specify the namespace, serviceportname, porttypename, and bindingname attributes.

namespace.name: namespace
namespace.help: Specifies the namespace used in the WSDL when using the CFC as a document-literal style web service. If you don't specify this attribute, ColdFusion MX derives the namespace from the CFC class name. This attribute applies only when style="document".

serviceportname.name: serviceportname
serviceportname.help: Specifies the name of the port element in the WSDL. This attribute applies only when style="document".

porttypename.name: porttypename
porttypename.help: Specifies the name of the porttype element in the WSDL. This attribute applies only when style="document".

bindingname.name: bindingname
bindingname.help: Specifies the name of the binding element in the WSDL. This attribute applies only when style="document".

wsdlfile.name: wsdlfile
wsdlfile.help: A properly formatted WSDL file to be used instead of WSDL generated by ColdFusion MX. This attribute applies only when style="document".

serviceaddress.name: serviceaddress
serviceaddress.help: Specifies the SOAP URL of the web service.

persistent.name: persistent
persistent.help: Specifies CFC is persistent or not

entityName.name: entityName
entityName.help: Specifies the name of the entity. Entity name is the name used by the ORM related functions to work with the persistent CFC. If entityName is not specified, then the CFC name is taken as the entityName. The entityName must be unique in the application.

table.name: table
table.help: Specifies the name of the database table to which the CFC maps.

schema.name: schema
schema.help: Used to specify the schema name.

catalog.name: catalog
catalog.help: Used to specify the database catalog name.

dynamicinsert.name: dynamicinsert
dynamicinsert.help: Specifies whether INSERT SQL is to be generated at runtime. Only those columns whose values are not null are included in the SQL.

dynamicupdate.name: dynamicupdate
dynamicupdate.help: Specifies whether UPDATE SQL is to be generated at runtime. Only those columns whose values are not null are included in the SQL.

readonly.name: readonly
readonly.help: Specify whether table is readonly or not

selectbeforeupdate.name: selectbeforeupdate
selectbeforeupdate.help: Specify whether Hibernate should never perform an SQL UPDATE unless it is certain that an object is actually modified. In cases when a transient object is associated with a new session using update(), Hibernate performs an extra SQL SELECT to determine if an UPDATE is actually required.

batchsize.name: batchsize
batchsize.help: An integer value that specifies the number of records to be retrieved at a single instance.

optimisticlock.name: optimisticlock
optimisticlock.help: Determines the locking strategy. It can be any one of the following four values: none version dirty all

lazy.name: lazy
lazy.help: If true, the component loads lazily.

discriminatorColumn.name: discriminatorColumn
discriminatorColumn.help: Defines the discriminator column to be used in inheritance mapping

discriminatorValue.name: discriminatorValue
discriminatorValue.help: Defines the discriminator value to be used in inheritance mapping

joinColumn.name: joinColumn
joinColumn.help: Defines the join column for inheritance mapping.

cacheUse.name: cacheUse
cacheUse.help: Specifies the caching strategy to be used for caching this component's data in the secondary cache

cacheName.name: cacheName
cacheName.help: Specifies name of the secondary cache.

saveMapping.name: saveMapping
saveMapping.help: Specifies whether the generated Hibernate mapping file has to be saved to disk. If you set the value to true, the Hibernate mapping XML file is saved with the filename "CFC name".hbm.xml in the same directory as the CFC.

accessors.name: accessors
accessors.help: If set to false, ColdFusion ORM does not generate the implicit getters and setters.

serializable.name: serializable
serializable.help: Specifies whether this component can be serialized. If you set this value to false, the component and the data in the component’s This and Variables scopes cannot be serialized, so they are not retained on session replication, and the component is in its default state.

alias.name: alias
alias.help: Specifies the type label to give the object when it is converted from CFML to ActionScript 3. It matches the alias attribute of AS3 types. This is attribute applies only to Flash Remoting and LiveCycle Data Services value objects, and lets you work with typed objects in both ColdFusion and Flash.

datasource.name: datasource
datasource.help: Datasource to use for this CFC. If you do not specify a datasource, the default datasource is used for that CFC.

mappedSuperClass.name: mappedSuperClass
mappedSuperClass.help: If set to true on a non-persistent CFC, child CFCs can inherit its properties. For instance, you can define a base cfc with common properties such as ID, version, or createdOn which all other persistent CFCs would extend and thus get one common behavior.MappedSuperClass attribute can not be set to true on a persistent CFC.

rest.name: rest
rest.help: Enables the CFC as root rest resource.

restPath.name: restPath
restPath.help: Specifies the URI path that a resource CFC will serve requests for

httpMethod.name: httpMethod
httpMethod.help: The default HttpMethod value used by all the CFFunctions defined in the CFC

produces.name: produces
produces.help: The Default Produces value used by all the CFFunctions defined in the CFC

consumes.name: consumes
consumes.help: The Default Consumes value used by all the CFFunctions defined in the CFC

indexable.name: indexable
indexable.help: If true, marks the column for indexing. Except in the case of PK and compositekey (which are indexed if any of the non-PK property is set to indexed), the default value is false

indexLanguage.name: indexLanguage
indexLanguage.help: Specify the language that is used to index and search. The value overrides the value defined in cfcomponent and the Application.cfc

autoindex.name: autoindex
autoindex.help: If false, auto-indexing of CFC does not occur. The value set here overrides the value defined in the Application.cfc

wsversion.name: wsversion
wsversion.help: Specifies version of the Axis engine to be used. If the wsversion is "1" then Axis 1 will be used else if it is "2" then axis 2 will be used

client.name: client
client.help: Specifies if this CFC is a client side CFC

reuseinstance.name: reuseinstance
reuseinstance.help: Specifies whether to reuse cached CFC instance to serve web service request or not.

cfcontent.name: cfcontent
cfcontent.help: Does either or both of the following: * Sets the MIME content encoding header for the current page * Sends the contents of a file from the server as the page output

type.name: type
type.help: The MIME content type of the page, optionally followed by a semicolon and the character encoding. By default, CFML sends pages as text/html content type in the UTF-8 character encoding.

deletefile.name: deletefile
deletefile.help: Applies only if you specify a file with the file attribute.  Yes: deletes the file on the server after sending its contents to the client. No: leaves the file on the server.

file.name: file
file.help: Name of file whose contents will be the page output. When using CFML in a distributed configuration, the file attribute must refer to a path on the system on which the web server runs. When you use this attribute, any other output on the current CFML page is ignored; only the contents of the file is sent to the client.

variable.name: variable
variable.help: Name of a ColdFusion binary variable whose contents can be displayed by the browser, such as the contents of a chart generated by the cfchart tag or a PDF or Excel file retrieved by a cffile action="readBinary" tag. When you use this attribute, any other output on the current CFML page is ignored; only the contents of the file are sent to the client.

reset.name: reset
reset.help: The reset and file attributes are mutually exclusive. If you specify a file, this attribute has no effect.  Yes: discards output that precedes call to cfcontent No: preserves output that precedes call to cfcontent. In this case all output is sent with the specified type.

cfcookie (name).name: cfcookie
cfcookie (name).help: Defines web browser cookie variables, including expiration and security options.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of cookie variable. CFML converts cookie names to all-uppercase. Cookie names set using this tag can include any printable ASCII characters except commas, semicolons or white space characters.

value.name: value
value.help: Value to assign to cookie variable. Must be a string or variable that can be stored as a string.

expires.name: expires
expires.help: Expiration of cookie variable.  * The default: the cookie expires when the user closes the browser, that is, the cookie is "session only". * A date or date/time object (for example, 10/09/97) * A number of days (for example, 10, or 100) * now: deletes cookie from client cookie.txt file (but does not delete the corresponding variable the Cookie scope of the active page). * never: The cookie expires in 30 years from the time it was created (effectively never in web years).

secure.name: secure
secure.help: If browser does not support Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) security, the cookie is not sent. To use the cookie, the page must be accessed using the https protocol.

path.name: path
path.help: URL, within a domain, to which the cookie applies; typically a directory. Only pages in this path can use the cookie. By default, all pages on the server that set the cookie can access the cookie.  path = "/services/login"

domain.name: domain
domain.help: Domain in which cookie is valid and to which cookie content can be sent from the user's system. By default, the cookie is only available to the server that set it. Use this attribute to make the cookie available to other servers.  Must start with a period. If the value is a subdomain, the valid domain is all domain names that end with this string. This attribute sets the available subdomains on the site upon which the cookie can be used.

httpOnly.name: httpOnly
httpOnly.help: Specify whether coockie is http coockie or not

casesensitive.name: casesensitive
casesensitive.help: If cookie name is case sensitive or not

encodevalue.name: encodevalue
encodevalue.help: If cookie value should be encoded or not

preservecase.name: preservecase
preservecase.help: Flag to indicate if case of the value should be preserved

cfcookie.help: Defines web browser cookie variables, including expiration and security options.

Use this attribute to make the cookie available to other servers.  Must start with a period. If the value is a subdomain, the valid domain is all domain names that end with this string. This attribute sets the available subdomains on the site upon which the cookie can be used.

httpOnly.name: httpOnly
httpOnly.help: Specify whether coockie is http coockie or not

casesensitive.name: casesensitive
