encodevalue.name: encodevalue
encodevalue.help: If cookie value should be encoded or not

preservecase.name: preservecase
preservecase.help: Flag to indicate if case of the value should be preserved

cfdbinfo.name: cfdbinfo
cfdbinfo.help: Lets you retrieve information about a data source, including details about the database, tables, queries, procedures, foreign keys, indexes, and version information about the database, driver, and JDBC

type.name: type
type.help: Type of information to get:  * dbnames: database name and type * tables: name, type, and remarks * columns: name, SQL data type, size, decimal precision, default value, maximum length in bytes of a character or integer data type column, whether nulls are allowed, ordinal position, remarks, whether the column is a primary key, whether the column is a foreign key, the table that the foreign key refers to, the key name the foreign key refers to * version: database product name and version, driver name and version, JDBC major and minor version * procedures: name, type, and remarks * foreignkeys: foreign key name and table, primary key name, delete and update rules * index: name, column on which the index is applied, ordinal position, cardinality, whether the row represents a table statistic or an index, number of pages used by the table or index, whether the index values are unique

datasource.name: datasource
datasource.help: Datasource to use to connect to the database.

name.name: name
name.help: Name to use to refer to the result.

username.name: username
username.help: User name to connect to the database.

password.name: password
password.help: Password to connect to the database.

pattern.name: pattern
pattern.help: Used only if type = "tables" ,type = "columns" , or type = "procedures" . Specifies a filter to retrieve information about specific tables, columns, or stored procedures. Use an underline (_) to represent a single wildcard character and a percent sign (%) to represent a wildcard of zero or more characters.

table.name: table
table.help: Name of the table from which you retrieve information.

cfdefaultcase.name: cfdefaultcase
cfdefaultcase.help: Used only inside the cfswitch tag body. Contains code to execute when the expression specified in the cfswitch tag does not match any of the values specified by preceeding cfcase tags.

cfdirectory.name: cfdirectory
cfdirectory.help: Manages interactions with directories. Different combos cause different attributes to be required.

action.name: action
action.help: Action to perform

directory.name: directory
directory.help: Absolute pathname of directory against which to perform action.

name.name: name
name.help: Name for output record set.

filter.name: filter
filter.help: File extension filter applied to returned names. For example: *.cfm. One filter can be applied.

mode.name: mode
mode.help: Applies only to UNIX and Linux. Permissions. Octal values of Unix chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.

sort.name: sort
sort.help: Query column(s) by which to sort directory listing. Delimited list of columns from query output.

recurse.name: recurse
recurse.help: Whether ColdFusion performs the action on subdirectories.

type.name: type
type.help: *  file: includes only filenames. * dir: includes only directory names. * all: includes both filenames and directory names.

listinfo.name: listinfo
listinfo.help: *  all: includes all information in the result set. * name: includes only filenames in the result set.

storeLocation.name: storeLocation
storeLocation.help: Location of the created bucket. The location can either be EU or US. The default location is US.

storeACL.name: storeACL
storeACL.help: An array of struct where each struct represents a permission or grant.

cfdiv.name: cfdiv
cfdiv.help: Creates an HTML tag with specified contents and lets you to use bind expressions to dynamically control the tag contents.

id.name: id
id.help: The HTML ID attribute value to assign to the generated container tag.

onBindError.name: onBindError
onBindError.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandler function), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.

bind.name: bind
bind.help: A bind expression that returns the container contents. Note: If a CFML page specified in this attribute contains tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfwindow, you must use a tag on the page with the  tag. For more information, see cfajaximport.

tagName.name: tagName
tagName.help: The HTML container tag to create.

bindonload.name: bindonload
bindonload.help: *  true: executes the bind attribute expression when first loading the tag. * false: does not execute the bind attribute expression until the first bound event . To use this attribute, you must also specify a bind attribute.

cfdocument (format).name: cfdocument
cfdocument (format).help: Creates PDF or FlashPaper output from a text block containing CFML and HTML.

filename.name: filename
filename.help: Specifies the fully qualified path name of a file to contain the PDF or FlashPaper output. If you omit the filename attribute, ColdFusion MX streams output to the browser.

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: Specifies whether ColdFusion MX overwrites an existing file. Used in conjunction with filename. Default is: false

name.name: name
name.help: Specifies the name of an existing variable into which the tag stores the PDF or FlashPaper output.

pagetype.name: pagetype
pagetype.help: Specifies the page size into which ColdFusion generates the report. - legal: 8.5 inches x 14 inches - letter: 8.5 inches x 11 inches - A4: 8.27 inches x 11.69 inches - A5: 5.81 inches x 8.25 inches - B5: 9.81 inches x 13.88 inches - Custom: Custom height and width. If you specify custom, you must also specify the pageheight and pagewidth attributes, can optionally specify margin attributes, and can optionally specify whether the units are inches or centimeters.

pageheight.name: pageheight
pageheight.help: Specifies the page height in inches (default) or centimeters. This attribute is only valid if pagetype=custom. To specify page height in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

pagewidth.name: pagewidth
pagewidth.help: Specifies the page width in inches (default) or centimeters. This attribute is only valid if pagetype=custom. To specify page width in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

orientation.name: orientation
orientation.help: Specifies the page orientation. Specify either of the following: - portrait (default) - landscape

margintop.name: margintop
margintop.help: Specifies the top margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify top margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

marginbottom.name: marginbottom
marginbottom.help: Specifies the bottom margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify bottom margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

marginleft.name: marginleft
marginleft.help: Specifies the left margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify left margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

marginright.name: marginright
marginright.help: Specifies the right margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify right margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

unit.name: unit
unit.help: Specifies the default unit (inches or centimeters) for pageheight, pagewidth, and margin attributes.

encryption.name: encryption
encryption.help: Specifies whether the output is encrypted (format="PDF" only). Default is: none

permissions.name: permissions
permissions.help: Specifies one or more permissions (format="PDF" only). Separate multiple permissions with a comma.

fontembed.name: fontembed
fontembed.help: Specifies whether ColdFusion embeds fonts in the output. Specify one of the following: - true: Embed fonts - false: Do not embed fonts. Selective: Embed all fonts except Java fonts and core fonts.

backgroundvisible.name: backgroundvisible
backgroundvisible.help: Specifies whether the background prints when the user prints the document: - yes: include the background when printing. - no: do not include the background when printing.

scale.name: scale
scale.help: Specifies a scale factor as a percentage. Use this option to reduce the size of the HTML output so that it fits on that paper. Specify a number less than 100.

authpassword.name: authpassword
authpassword.help: Password sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

authuser.name: authuser
authuser.help: User name sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

bookmark.name: bookmark
bookmark.help: Specifies whether bookmarks are created in the document: * yes: creates bookmarks. * no: does not create bookmarks.

localurl.name: localurl
localurl.help: Specifies whether to retrieve image files directly from the local drive: * yes: ColdFusion retrieves image files directly from the local drive rather than by using HTTP, HTTPS, or proxy. * no: ColdFusion uses HTTP, HTTPS, or proxy to retrieve image files even if the files are stored locally.

mimetype.name: mimetype
mimetype.help: MIME type of the source document

proxypassword.name: proxypassword
proxypassword.help: Password required by the proxy server.

proxyuser.name: proxyuser
proxyuser.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.

saveasname.name: saveasname
saveasname.help: (format="PDF" only) The filename that appears in the SaveAs dialog when a user saves a PDF file written to the browser.

src.name: src
src.help: URL or the relative path to the web root. You cannot specify both the src and srcfile attributes. The file must be in a browser-writable format such as, HTML, HTM, BMP, PNG, and so on.

srcfile.name: srcfile
srcfile.help: Absolute path of a file that is on the server. You cannot specify both the src and srcfile attributes. The file must be in a browser-writable format such as, HTML, HTM, BMP, PNG, and so on.

useragent.name: useragent
useragent.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.

proxyhost.name: proxyhost
proxyhost.help: IP address or server name for proxy host.

tagged.name: tagged
tagged.help: Determines if PDF are created by using special tags also known as Tagged PDF

pdfa.name: pdfa
pdfa.help: Creates a PDF of type PDF/A-1 (ISO 19005-1:2005)

formFields.name: formFields
formFields.help: Specifies whether form fields are exported as widgets or only their fixed print representation is exported.

formsType.name: formsType
formsType.help: Specifies the submitted format of a PDF form.

permissionsPassword.name: permissionsPassword
permissionsPassword.help: This is the password that allows the user to access some permissions restricted if some permissions need to be restricted. The permissions are defined in "permissions" attribute

openPassword.name: openPassword
openPassword.help: If the source document is protected specify using this attribute.

cfdocument.name: cfdocument
cfdocument.help: Creates PDF or FlashPaper output from a text block containing CFML and HTML.

filename.name: filename
filename.help: Specifies the fully qualified path name of a file to contain the PDF or FlashPaper output. If you omit the filename attribute, ColdFusion MX streams output to the browser.

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: Specifies whether ColdFusion MX overwrites an existing file. Used in conjunction with filename. Default is: false

name.name: name
name.help: Specifies the name of an existing variable into which the tag stores the PDF or FlashPaper output.

pagetype.name: pagetype
pagetype.help: Specifies the page size into which ColdFusion generates the report. - legal: 8.5 inches x 14 inches - letter: 8.5 inches x 11 inches - A4: 8.27 inches x 11.69 inches - A5: 5.81 inches x 8.25 inches - B5: 9.81 inches x 13.88 inches - Custom: Custom height and width. If you specify custom, you must also specify the pageheight and pagewidth attributes, can optionally specify margin attributes, and can optionally specify whether the units are inches or centimeters.

pageheight.name: pageheight
pageheight.help: Specifies the page height in inches (default) or centimeters. This attribute is only valid if pagetype=custom. To specify page height in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

pagewidth.name: pagewidth
pagewidth.help: Specifies the page width in inches (default) or centimeters. This attribute is only valid if pagetype=custom. To specify page width in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

orientation.name: orientation
orientation.help: Specifies the page orientation. Specify either of the following: - portrait (default) - landscape

margintop.name: margintop
margintop.help: Specifies the top margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify top margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

marginbottom.name: marginbottom
marginbottom.help: Specifies the bottom margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify bottom margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

marginleft.name: marginleft
marginleft.help: Specifies the left margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify left margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

marginright.name: marginright
marginright.help: Specifies the right margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify right margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

unit.name: unit
unit.help: Specifies the default unit (inches or centimeters) for pageheight, pagewidth, and margin attributes.

encryption.name: encryption
encryption.help: Specifies whether the output is encrypted (format="PDF" only). Default is: none

permissions.name: permissions
permissions.help: Specifies one or more permissions (format="PDF" only). Separate multiple permissions with a comma.

fontembed.name: fontembed
fontembed.help: Specifies whether ColdFusion embeds fonts in the output. Specify one of the following: - true: Embed fonts - false: Do not embed fonts. Selective: Embed all fonts except Java fonts and core fonts.

backgroundvisible.name: backgroundvisible
backgroundvisible.help: Specifies whether the background prints when the user prints the document: - yes: include the background when printing. - no: do not include the background when printing.

scale.name: scale
scale.help: Specifies a scale factor as a percentage. Use this option to reduce the size of the HTML output so that it fits on that paper. Specify a number less than 100.

authpassword.name: authpassword
authpassword.help: Password sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

authuser.name: authuser
authuser.help: User name sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

bookmark.name: bookmark
bookmark.help: Specifies whether bookmarks are created in the document: * yes: creates bookmarks. * no: does not create bookmarks.

localurl.name: localurl
localurl.help: Specifies whether to retrieve image files directly from the local drive: * yes: ColdFusion retrieves image files directly from the local drive rather than by using HTTP, HTTPS, or proxy. * no: ColdFusion uses HTTP, HTTPS, or proxy to retrieve image files even if the files are stored locally.

mimetype.name: mimetype
mimetype.help: MIME type of the source document

proxypassword.name: proxypassword
proxypassword.help: Password required by the proxy server.

proxyuser.name: proxyuser
proxyuser.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.

saveasname.name: saveasname
saveasname.help: (format="PDF" only) The filename that appears in the SaveAs dialog when a user saves a PDF file written to the browser.

src.name: src
src.help: URL or the relative path to the web root. You cannot specify both the src and srcfile attributes. The file must be in a browser-writable format such as, HTML, HTM, BMP, PNG, and so on.

srcfile.name: srcfile
srcfile.help: Absolute path of a file that is on the server. You cannot specify both the src and srcfile attributes. The file must be in a browser-writable format such as, HTML, HTM, BMP, PNG, and so on.

useragent.name: useragent
useragent.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.

proxyhost.name: proxyhost
proxyhost.help: IP address or server name for proxy host.

tagged.name: tagged
tagged.help: Determines if PDF are created by using special tags also known as Tagged PDF

pdfa.name: pdfa
pdfa.help: Creates a PDF of type PDF/A-1 (ISO 19005-1:2005)

formFields.name: formFields
formFields.help: Specifies whether form fields are exported as widgets or only their fixed print representation is exported.

formsType.name: formsType
formsType.help: Specifies the submitted format of a PDF form.

permissionsPassword.name: permissionsPassword
permissionsPassword.help: This is the password that allows the user to access some permissions restricted if some permissions need to be restricted. The permissions are defined in "permissions" attribute

openPassword.name: openPassword
openPassword.help: If the source document is protected specify using this attribute.

cfdocumentitem (type).name: cfdocumentitem
cfdocumentitem (type).help: Specifies action items for a PDF or FlashPaper document created by the cfdocument tag.

help._: Specifies the action: - pagebreak: start a new page at the location of the tag. - header: use the text between the  tags as the running header. - footer: use the text between the  tags as the running footer.

evalAtPrint.name: evalAtPrint
evalAtPrint.help: Specifies whether to evaluate expressions inside cfdocumentitem tag at runtime.

cfdocumentitem.name: cfdocumentitem
cfdocumentitem.help: Specifies action items for a PDF or FlashPaper document created by the cfdocument tag.

help._: Specifies the action: - pagebreak: start a new page at the location of the tag. - header: use the text between the  tags as the running header. - footer: use the text between the  tags as the running footer.

evalAtPrint.name: evalAtPrint
evalAtPrint.help: Specifies whether to evaluate expressions inside cfdocumentitem tag at runtime.

cfdocumentsection.name: cfdocumentsection
cfdocumentsection.help: Divides a PDF or FlashPaper document into sections. By using this tag in conjunction with a cfdocumentitem tag, each section can have unique headers, footers, and page numbers.

margintop.name: margintop
margintop.help: Specifies the top margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify the top margin in centimeters, include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument tag.

marginbottom.name: marginbottom
marginbottom.help: Specifies the bottom margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify the bottom margin in centimeters, include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument tag.

marginleft.name: marginleft
marginleft.help: Specifies the left margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify the left margin in centimeters, include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument tag.

marginright.name: marginright
marginright.help: Specifies the right margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify the right margin in centimeters, include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument tag.

authpassword.name: authpassword
authpassword.help: Password sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

authuser.name: authuser
authuser.help: User name sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

mimetype.name: mimetype
mimetype.help: MIME type of the source document

name.name: name
name.help: Bookmark name for the section.

src.name: src
src.help: URL or the relative path to the web root. You cannot specify both the src and srcfile attributes.

srcfile.name: srcfile
srcfile.help: Absolute path of a file that is on the server. You cannot specify both the src and srcfile attributes.

useragent.name: useragent
useragent.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.

cfdump.name: cfdump
cfdump.help: Outputs the elements, variables and values of most kinds of CFML objects. Useful for debugging. You can display the contents of simple and complex variables, objects, components, user-defined functions, and other elements.

var.name: var
var.help: Variable to display. Enclose a variable name in pound signs.

expand.name: expand
expand.help: Yes: In Internet Explorer and Mozilla, expands views

format.name: format
format.help: Specify whether to save the results of a cfdump to a file in text or HTML format

keys.name: keys
keys.help: For a structure, number of keys to display.

label.name: label
label.help: A string; header for the dump output.

metainfo.name: metainfo
metainfo.help: Includes information about the query in the cfdump results.

output.name: output
output.help: Where to send the results of cfdump.

top.name: top
top.help: The number of rows to display.

cfelse.name: cfelse
cfelse.help: Used as the last control block in a cfif tag block to handle any case not identified by the cfif tag or a cfelseif tag.

cfelseif.name: cfelseif
cfelseif.help: Used as a control block in a cfif tag block to handle any case not identified by the cfif tag or a cfelseif tag.

cferror (template).name: cferror
cferror (template).help: Displays a custom HTML page when an error occurs. This lets you maintain a consistent look and feel among an application's functional and error pages

type.name: type
type.help: Type of error that the custom error page handles. The type also determines how CFML handles the error page. For more information, see Specifying a custom error page in Developing CFML MX Applications.  exception: a exception of the type specified by the exception attribute. validation: errors recognized by sever-side type validation. request: any encountered error.

template.name: template
template.help: Relative path to the custom error page. (A CFML page was formerly called a template.)

mailto.name: mailto
mailto.help: An E-mail address. This attribute is available on the error page as the variable error.mailto. CFML does not automatically send anything to this address.

exception.name: exception
exception.help: Type of exception that the tag handles:  application: application exceptions database: database exceptions template: CFML page exceptions security: security exceptions object: object exceptions missingInclude: missing include file exceptions expression: expression exceptions lock: lock exceptions custom_type: developer-defined exceptions, defined in the cfthrow tag any: all exception types

cferror (type).name: cferror
cferror (type).help: Displays a custom HTML page when an error occurs. This lets you maintain a consistent look and feel among an application's functional and error pages

type.name: type
type.help: Type of error that the custom error page handles. The type also determines how CFML handles the error page. For more information, see Specifying a custom error page in Developing CFML MX Applications.  exception: a exception of the type specified by the exception attribute. validation: errors recognized by sever-side type validation. request: any encountered error.

template.name: template
template.help: Relative path to the custom error page. (A CFML page was formerly called a template.)

mailto.name: mailto
mailto.help: An E-mail address. This attribute is available on the error page as the variable error.mailto. CFML does not automatically send anything to this address.

exception.name: exception
exception.help: Type of exception that the tag handles:  application: application exceptions database: database exceptions template: CFML page exceptions security: security exceptions object: object exceptions missingInclude: missing include file exceptions expression: expression exceptions lock: lock exceptions custom_type: developer-defined exceptions, defined in the cfthrow tag any: all exception types

cferror.name: cferror
cferror.help: Displays a custom HTML page when an error occurs. This lets you maintain a consistent look and feel among an application's functional and error pages

type.name: type
type.help: Type of error that the custom error page handles. The type also determines how CFML handles the error page. For more information, see Specifying a custom error page in Developing CFML MX Applications.  exception: a exception of the type specified by the exception attribute. validation: errors recognized by sever-side type validation. request: any encountered error.

template.name: template
template.help: Relative path to the custom error page. (A CFML page was formerly called a template.)

mailto.name: mailto
mailto.help: An E-mail address. This attribute is available on the error page as the variable error.mailto. CFML does not automatically send anything to this address.

exception.name: exception
exception.help: Type of exception that the tag handles:  application: application exceptions database: database exceptions template: CFML page exceptions security: security exceptions object: object exceptions missingInclude: missing include file exceptions expression: expression exceptions lock: lock exceptions custom_type: developer-defined exceptions, defined in the cfthrow tag any: all exception types

cfexecute (name).name: cfexecute
cfexecute (name).help: Executes a CFML developer-specified process on a server computer.

name.name: name
name.help: Absolute path of the application to execute.  On Windows, you must specify an extension; for example, C:\myapp.exe.

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.help: Command-line variables passed to application. If specified as string, it is processed as follows: * Windows: passed to process control subsystem for parsing. * UNIX: tokenized into an array of arguments. The default token separator is a space; you can delimit arguments that have embedded spaces with double quotation marks. If passed as array, it is processed as follows: * Windows: elements are concatenated into a string of tokens, separated by spaces. Passed to process control subsystem for parsing. * UNIX: elements are copied into an array of exec() arguments

outputfile.name: outputfile
outputfile.help: File to which to direct program output. If no outputfile or variable attribute is specified, output is displayed on the page from which it was called.  If not an absolute path (starting a with a drive letter and a colon, or a forward or backward slash), it is relative to the CFML temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function.

variable.name: variable
variable.help: Variable in which to put program output. If no outputfile or variable attribute is specified, output is displayed on page from which it was called.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Length of time, in seconds, that CFML waits for output from the spawned program.

errorVariable.name: errorVariable
errorVariable.help: The name of a variable in which to save the error stream output.

errorFile.name: errorFile
errorFile.help: The pathname of a file in which to save the error stream output. If not an absolute path (starting a with a drive letter and a colon, or a forward or backward slash), it is relative to the ColdFusion temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function.

cfexecute.name: cfexecute
cfexecute.help: Executes a CFML developer-specified process on a server computer.

name.name: name
name.help: Absolute path of the application to execute.  On Windows, you must specify an extension; for example, C:\myapp.exe.

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.help: Command-line variables passed to application. If specified as string, it is processed as follows: * Windows: passed to process control subsystem for parsing. * UNIX: tokenized into an array of arguments. The default token separator is a space; you can delimit arguments that have embedded spaces with double quotation marks. If passed as array, it is processed as follows: * Windows: elements are concatenated into a string of tokens, separated by spaces. Passed to process control subsystem for parsing. * UNIX: elements are copied into an array of exec() arguments

outputfile.name: outputfile
outputfile.help: File to which to direct program output. If no outputfile or variable attribute is specified, output is displayed on the page from which it was called.  If not an absolute path (starting a with a drive letter and a colon, or a forward or backward slash), it is relative to the CFML temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function.

variable.name: variable
variable.help: Variable in which to put program output. If no outputfile or variable attribute is specified, output is displayed on page from which it was called.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Length of time, in seconds, that CFML waits for output from the spawned program.

errorVariable.name: errorVariable
errorVariable.help: The name of a variable in which to save the error stream output.

errorFile.name: errorFile
errorFile.help: The pathname of a file in which to save the error stream output. If not an absolute path (starting a with a drive letter and a colon, or a forward or backward slash), it is relative to the ColdFusion temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function.

cfexit.name: cfexit
cfexit.help: This tag aborts processing of the currently executing CFML custom tag, exits the page within the currently executing CFML custom tag, or re-executes a section of code within the currently executing CFML custom tag.

method.name: method
method.help: exittag: aborts processing of currently executing tag exittemplate: exits page of currently executing tag loop: reexecutes body of currently executing tag

cffile.name: cffile
cffile.help: Manages interactions with server files. Different combinations cause different attributes to be required.

action.name: action
action.help: Type of file manipulation that the tag performs.

file.name: file
file.help: Pathname of the file. Also supports ZIP files and files accessed using protocols HTTP, FTP and VFS.

mode.name: mode
mode.help: Applies only to UNIX and Linux. Permissions. Octal values of Unix chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.

output.name: output
output.help: String to add to the file

addnewline.name: addnewline
addnewline.help: Yes: appends newline character to text written to file

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.help: Applies to Windows. A comma-delimited list of attributes to set on the file.  If omitted, the file's attributes are maintained.

charset.name: charset
charset.help: The character encoding in which the file contents is encoded.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

destination.name: destination
destination.help: Pathname of a directory or file on web server (durring copy).

variable.name: variable
variable.help: Name of variable to contain contents of text file.

filefield.name: filefield
filefield.help: Name of form field used to select the file.  Do not use pound signs (#) to specify the field name.

nameconflict.name: nameconflict
nameconflict.help: Action to take if filename is the same as that of a file in the directory.

accept.name: accept
accept.help: Limits the MIME types to accept. Comma-delimited list. For example, to permit JPG and Microsoft Word file uploads:  accept = "image/jpg, application/msword"

result.name: result
result.help: Allows you to specify a name for the variable in which cffile returns the result (or status) parameters. If you do not specify a value for this attribute, cffile uses the prefix "cffile".

fixnewline.name: fixnewline
fixnewline.help: * Yes: changes embedded line-ending characters in string variables to operating-system specific line endings * No: (default) do not change embedded line-ending characters in string variables.

strict.name: strict
strict.help: Set strict='true' to have strict mime type checking for mime type specified in "accept" attribute, when action is upload or uploadAll.

cfflush.name: cfflush
cfflush.help: Flushes currently available data to the client.

interval.name: interval
interval.help: Flushes output each time this number of bytes becomes available. HTML headers, and data that is already available when the tag is executed, are omitted from the count.

cfform.name: cfform
cfform.help: Builds a form with CFML custom control tags; these provide more functionality than standard HTML form input elements.

name.name: name
name.help: In HTML format, if you omit this attribute and specify an id attribute, ColdFusion does not include a name attribute in the HTML sent to the browser; this behavior lets you use the cfform tag to create XHTML-compliant forms. If you omit the name attribute and the id attribute, ColdFusion generates a name of the form CFForm_n where n is a number that assigned serially to the forms on a page.

action.name: action
action.help: Name of CFML page to execute when the form is submitted for processing.

method.name: method
method.help: The method the browser uses to send the form data to the server: - post: Send the data using the HTTP post method, This method sends the data in a separate message to the server. - get: Send the data using the HTTP get method, which puts the form field contents in the URL query string.

format.name: format
format.help: - HTML: Generate an HTML form and send it to the client. cfgrid and cftree child controls can be in Flash or applet format. - Flash: Generate a Flash form and send it to the client. All controls are in Flash format. - XML: Generate XForms-compliant XML and save the results in a variable specified by the name attribute. By default, ColdFusion also applies an XSL skin and displays the result. For more information, see the skin attribute

skin.name: skin
skin.help: Flash: Use a Macromedia halo color to stylize the output. XML: Specfies whether to apply an XSL skin and display the resulting HTML to the client. Can be any of the following: - ColdFusion MX skin name: Apply the specified skin. - XSL file name: Apply the skin located in the specified path. - "none": Do not apply an XSL skin. You must use XForms XML then. - (omitted) or "default": Use the ColdFusion MX default skin.

preservedata.name: preservedata
preservedata.help: When the cfform action attribute posts back to the same page as the form, this determines whether to override the control values with the submitted values. - false: values specified in the control tag attributes are used - true: corresponding submitted values are used

onload.name: onload
onload.help: JavaScript to execute when the form loads.

onsubmit.name: onsubmit
onsubmit.help: JavaScript or Actionscript function to execute to preprocess data before form is submitted. If any child tags specify onSubmit field validation, ColdFusion does the validation before executing this JavaScript.

codebase.name: codebase
codebase.help: URL of downloadable JRE plug-in (for Internet Explorer only). Default: /CFIDE/classes/cf-j2re-win.cab

archive.name: archive
archive.help: URL of downloadable Java classes for CFML controls. Default: /CFIDE/classes/cfapplets.jar

height.name: height
height.help: The height of the form. Use a number to specify pixels, In Flash, you can use a percentage value to specify a percentage of the available width. The displayed height might be less than the specified size.

width.name: width
width.help: The width of the form. Use a number to specify pixels, In Flash, you can use a percentage value to specify a percentage of the available width.

onerror.name: onerror
onerror.help: Applies only for onSubmit or onBlur validation; has no effect for onServer validation. An ActionScript expression or expressions to execute if the user submits a form with one or more validation errors.

wmode.name: wmode
wmode.help: Specifies how the Flash form appears relative to other displayable content that occupies the same space on an HTML page. - window: The Flash form is the topmost layer on the page and obscures anything that would share the space, such as drop-down dynamic HTML lists. - transparent: The Flash form honors the z-index of dhtml so you can float items above it. If the Flash form is above any item, transparent regions in the form show the content that is below it. - opaque: The Flash form honors the z-index of dhtml so you can float items above it. If the Flash form is above any item, it blocks any content that is below it. Default is: window.

accessible.name: accessible
accessible.help: Specifies whether to include support screen readers in the Flash form. Screen reader support adds approximately 80KB to the SWF file sent to the client. Default is: false.

preloader.name: preloader
preloader.help: Specifies whether to display a progress bar when loading the Flash form. Default is: true.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Integer number of seconds for which to keep the form data in the Flash cache on the server. A value of 0 prevents the data from being cached.

scriptsrc.name: scriptsrc
scriptsrc.help: Specifies the URL, relative to the web root, of the directory that contains the cfform.js file with the client-side JavaScript used by this tag and its child tags. For XML format forms, this directory is also the default directory for XSLT skins.

style.name: style
style.help: Styles to apply to the form. In HTML or XML format, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format, must be a style specification in CSS format.

onreset.name: onreset
onreset.help: JavaScript to execute when the user clicks a reset button.

id.name: id
id.help: HTML id passed through to FORM.

target.name: target
target.help: Target window or frame passed through to FORM.

onsuccess.name: onsuccess
onsuccess.help: Applies only to forms inside cfdiv, cflayout, cfpod, or cfwindow controls. The name of a JavaScript function that will run when an asynchronous form submission succeeds.

enctype.name: enctype
enctype.help: Encoding type of the form-data when submitting the form

cfformgroup.name: cfformgroup
cfformgroup.help: Creates a container control for multiple form controls. Used in the cfform tag body of Macromedia Flash and XML forms. Ignored in HTML forms.

type.name: type
type.help: For XML forms can be any XForms group type defined in the XSLT. For Flash see the value options and docs for more information.

query.name: query
query.help: The query to use with the repeater. Flash creates an instance of each of the cfformgroup tag's child tags for each row in the query. You can use the bind attribute in the child tags to use data from the query row for the instance.

startrow.name: startrow
startrow.help: Used only for the repeater type; ignored otherwise. Specifies the row number of the first row of the query to use in the Flash form repeater. This attribute is zerobased: the first row is row 0, not row 1 (as in most ColdFusion tags). Default: 0

maxrows.name: maxrows
maxrows.help: Used only for for the repeater type; ignored otherwise. Specifies the maximum number of query rows to use in the Flash form repeater. If the query has more rows than the sum of the startrow attribute and this value, the repeater does not use the remaining rows.

label.name: label
label.help: Label to apply to the form group. In Flash, does the following: - For a page or panel form group, determines the label to put on the corresponding accordion pleat, the tabnavigator tab, or the panel title bar. For a Flash horizontal or vertical form group, specifies the label to put to the left of the group. - Ignored in Flash for repeater, hbox, hdividedbox, vbox, vdividedbox, tile, accordion, and tabnavigator types.

style.name: style
style.help: Flash: A Flash style specification in CSS format. XML: An inline CSS style specification.

selectedindex.name: selectedindex
selectedindex.help: Used only for accordion and tabnavigator types; ignored otherwise. Specifies the page control to display as open, where 0 (not 1) specifies the first page control defined in the group.

width.name: width
width.help: Width of the group container, in pixels. If you omit this attribute, Flash automatically sizes the container width. Ignored for Flash repeater type.

height.name: height
height.help: Height of the group container, in pixels. If you omit this attribute, Flash automatically sizes the container height. Ignored for Flash repeater type.

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the controls in the form group are enabled. Disabled controls appear in light gray. Default: true

visible.name: visible
visible.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the controls in the form group are visible. If the controls are invisible, the space that would be occupied by visible controls is blank. Default: true

onchange.name: onchange
onchange.help: Flash only: tabnavigator and accordion types only: ActionScript expression or expressions to execute when a new tab or accordion page is selected. Note: The onChange event occurs when the form first displays.

tooltip.name: tooltip
tooltip.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers in the form group area. If a control in the form group also specifies a tooltip, Flash displays the control's tolltip when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

cfformitem.name: cfformitem
cfformitem.help: Inserts a horizontal line, a vertical line, a spacer, or text in a Flash form. Used in the cfform or cfformgroup tag body for Flash and XML forms. Ignored in HTML forms.

type.name: type
type.help: Form item type. See docs for more details.

style.name: style
style.help: Flash: Must be a style specification in CSS format. Ignored if the type attribute is html or text. XML: ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the XML. ColdFusion skins include the style attribute to the generated HTML.

width.name: width
width.help: Width of the item, in pixels. If you omit this attribute, Flash automatically sizes the width. In ColdFusion XSL skins, use the style attribute, instead.

height.name: height
height.help: Height of the item, in pixels. If you omit this attribute, Flash automatically sizes the width. In ColdFusion XSL skins, use the style attribute, instead.

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.help: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. Disabled text appear in light gray. Has no effect on spacers and rules. Default: true

visible.name: visible
visible.help: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Has no effect on spacers. Default: true

tooltip.name: tooltip
tooltip.help: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control. Has no effect on spacers.

bind.name: bind
bind.help: A Flash bind expression that populates the field with information from other form fields. If you use this attribute, ColdFusion MX ignores any text that you specify in the body of the cftextitem tag. This attribute can be useful if the cfformitem tag is in a cfformgroup type="repeater" tag.

cfftp.name: cfftp
cfftp.help: Lets users implement File Transfer Protocol (FTP) operations.

action.name: action
action.help: FTP operation to perform. open: create an FTP connection close: terminate an FTP connection

username.name: username
username.help: Overrides username specified in ODBC setup.

password.name: password
password.help: Overrides password specified in ODBC setup.

server.name: server
server.help: FTP server to which to connect; for example, ftp.myserver.com

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: Value in seconds for the timeout of all operations, including individual data request operations.

port.name: port
port.help: Remote port to which to connect

connection.name: connection
connection.help: Name of the FTP connection. If you specify the username, password, and server attributes, and if no connection exists for them, CFML creates one. Calls to cfftp with the same connection name reuse the connection.

proxyserver.name: proxyserver
proxyserver.help: The proxy server required to access the URL.

retrycount.name: retrycount
retrycount.help: Number of retries until failure is reported.

stoponerror.name: stoponerror
stoponerror.help: Yes: halts processing, displays an appropriate error. No: populates the error variables

transfermode.name: transfermode
transfermode.help: ASCII FTP transfer mode Binary FTP transfer mode Auto FTP transfer mode

failifexists.name: failifexists
failifexists.help: Yes: if a local file with same name exists, getFile fails

directory.name: directory
directory.help: Directory on which to perform an operation

localfile.name: localfile
localfile.help: Name of the file on the local file system

remotefile.name: remotefile
remotefile.help: Name of the file on the FTP server file system.

item.name: item
item.help: Object of these actions: file or directory.

existing.name: existing
existing.help: Current name of the file or directory on the remote server.

new.name: new
new.help: New name of file or directory on the remote server

name.name: name
name.help: Query name of directory listing.

result.name: result
result.help: Specifies a name for the structure in which cfftp stores the returnValue variable. If set, this value replaces cfftp as the prefix to use when accessing returnVariable.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.help: Attributes of the current element: normal or Directory.

passphrase.name: passphrase
passphrase.help: Used when key is specified. Because private keys are stored in an encrypted form on the client host, the user must supply a passphrase to enable generating the signature.

asciiextensionlist.name: asciiextensionlist
asciiextensionlist.help: Delimited list of file extensions that force ASCII transfer mode, if transferMode = "auto".

key.name: key
key.help: Public-key-based authentication. Refers to the absolute path to the private key of the user. Possession of a private key provides authentication by sending a signature created with a private key. The server must ensure that the key is a valid authentication for the user and that the signature is valid. Both must be valid to accept the authentication.

actionparam.name: actionparam
actionparam.help: Used only when action is quote, site, or acct. Specifies the command when action is quote or site; specifies account information when action is acct.

fingerprint.name: fingerprint
fingerprint.help: Fingerprint of the host key in the form ssh-dss.ssh-rsa, which is a 16-byte unique identifier for the server attribute that you specify.

systemtype.name: systemtype
systemtype.help: A string representing the ftp server platform that should be used to parse each server file listing.

cffunction.name: cffunction
cffunction.help: Defines a function that you can call in CFML. Required to defined CFML component methods.

name.name: name
name.help: A string; a component method that is used within the cfcomponent tag.

returntype.name: returntype
returntype.help: String; a type name; data type of the function return value Required for a web service; Optional, otherwise.

roles.name: roles
roles.help: A comma-delimited list of CFML security roles that can invoke the method. Only users who are logged in with the specified roles can execute the function. If this attribute is omitted, all users can invoke the method

access.name: access
access.help: The client security context from which the method can be invoked:  private: available only to the component that declares the method and any components that extend the component in which it is defined package: available only to the component that declares the method, components that extend the component, or any other components in the package public: available to a locally executing page or component method remote: available to a locally or remotely executing page or component method, or a remote client through a URL, Flash, or a web service. To publish the function as a web service, this option is required.

output.name: output
output.help: Specifies under which conditions the function can generate HTML output.

displayname.name: displayname
displayname.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. A value to be displayed in parentheses following the function name when using introspection to show information about the CFC

hint.name: hint
hint.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The hint attribute value follows the syntax line in the function description

description.name: description
description.help: Supplies a short text description of the function.

returnformat.name: returnformat
returnformat.help: The format in which to return values to a remote caller.

securejson.name: securejson
securejson.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to add a security prefix in front of any value that the function returns in JSON-format in response to a remote call.

verifyclient.name: verifyclient
verifyclient.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to require remote function calls to include an encrypted security token. For use with ColdFusion AJAX applications only.

restPath.name: restPath
restPath.help: URI path. CFC method will serve request for this path.

httpMethod.name: httpMethod
httpMethod.help: Enables the cffunction to handle HTTP requests of the given HTTP method

produces.name: produces
produces.help: Specifies the media types that the CFFunction can produce. It can also be a comma separated string with multiple media types

consumes.name: consumes
consumes.help: Specifies the media types that the CFFunction can accept. It can also be a comma separated string with multiple media types

cfgrid (name).name: cfgrid
cfgrid (name).help: Used within the cfform tag. Puts a grid control (a table of data) in a CFML form. To specify grid columns and row data, use the cfgridcolumn and cfgridrow tags, or use the query attribute, with or without cfgridcolumn tags.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of grid element.

bind.name: bind
bind.help: A bind expression specifying used to fill the contents of the grid. Cannot be used with the query attribute.

pagesize.name: pagesize
pagesize.help: The number of rows to display per page for a dynamic grid. If the number of available rows exceeds the page size, the grid displays only the specified number of entries on a single page, and the user navigates between pages to show all data. The grid retrieves data for each page only when it is required for display. This attribute is ignored if you specify a query attribute.

striperowcolor.name: striperowcolor
striperowcolor.help: The color to use for one of the alternating stripes. The bgColor setting determines the other color

preservepageonsort.name: preservepageonsort
preservepageonsort.help: Specifies whether to display the page with the current page number, or display page 1, after sorting (or resorting) the grid

striperows.name: striperows
striperows.help: Specifies whether to display the page with the current page number, or display page 1, after sorting (or resorting) the grid

format.name: format
format.help: - applet: generates a Java applet. - Flash: generates a Flash grid control. - xml: generates an XMLrepresentation of the grid. In XML format forms, includes the generated XML in the form. In HTML format forms, puts the XML in a string variable with the name specified by the name attribute. Default: applet

height.name: height
height.help: Control's height, in pixels. Default for applet: 300

width.name: width
width.help: Control's width, in pixels. Default for applet: 300

autowidth.name: autowidth
autowidth.help: Yes: sets column widths so that all columns display within grid width. No: sets columns to equal widths. User can resize columns. Horizontal scroll bars are not available, because if you specify a column width and set autoWidth = "Yes", CFML sets to this width, if possible

vspace.name: vspace
vspace.help: Vertical margin above and below control, in pixels.

hspace.name: hspace
hspace.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of control, in pixels.

align.name: align
align.help: Alignment of the grid cell contents

query.name: query
query.help: Name of query associated with grid control.

insert.name: insert
insert.help: User can insert row data in grid. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit"

delete.name: delete
delete.help: User can delete row data from grid. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit"

sort.name: sort
sort.help: The sort button performs simple text sort on column. User can sort columns by clicking column head or by clicking sort buttons. Not valid with selectmode=browse.  Yes: sort buttons display on grid control

italic.name: italic
italic.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

bold.name: bold
bold.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

textcolor.name: textcolor
textcolor.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

href.name: href
href.help: URL or query column name that contains a URL to hyperlink each grid column with.

hrefkey.name: hrefkey
hrefkey.help: The query column to use for the value appended to the href URL of each column, instead of the column's value.

target.name: target
target.help: Frame in which to open link specified in href.

appendkey.name: appendkey
appendkey.help: When used with href, passes CFTREEITEMKEY variable with the value of the selected tree item in URL to the application page specified in the cfform action attribute

highlighthref.name: highlighthref
highlighthref.help: Yes: Highlights links that are associated with a cftreeitem with a URL attribute value. No: Disables highlight.

onvalidate.name: onvalidate
onvalidate.help: JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to the specified routine, which should return True if validation succeeds; False, otherwise.

onerror.name: onerror
onerror.help: JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

griddataalign.name: griddataalign
griddataalign.help: Left: left-aligns data within column. Right: right-aligns data within column. Center: center-aligns data within column.

gridlines.name: gridlines
gridlines.help: Yes: enables row and column rules in grid control

rowheight.name: rowheight
rowheight.help: Minimum row height, in pixels, of grid control. Used with cfgridcolumn type = "Image"; defines space for graphics to display in row.

rowheaders.name: rowheaders
rowheaders.help: Yes: displays a column of numeric row labels in grid control

rowheaderalign.name: rowheaderalign
rowheaderalign.help: Left: left-aligns data within row header Right: right-aligns data within row header Center: center-aligns data within row header

rowheaderitalic.name: rowheaderitalic
rowheaderitalic.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

rowheaderbold.name: rowheaderbold
rowheaderbold.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

rowheadertextcolor.name: rowheadertextcolor
rowheadertextcolor.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

colheaders.name: colheaders
colheaders.help: Yes: displays a column of numeric row labels in grid control

colheaderalign.name: colheaderalign
colheaderalign.help: Left: left-aligns data within row header Right: right-aligns data within row header Center: center-aligns data within row header

colheaderitalic.name: colheaderitalic
colheaderitalic.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

colheaderbold.name: colheaderbold
colheaderbold.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

colheadertextcolor.name: colheadertextcolor
colheadertextcolor.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

selectcolor.name: selectcolor
selectcolor.help: Background color for a selected item.

selectmode.name: selectmode
selectmode.help: Selection mode for items in the control. - Edit: user can edit grid data. Selecting a cell opens the editor for the cell type. - Row: user selections automatically extend to the row that contains selected cell. - Single: user selections are limited to selected cell. (Applet only) - Column: user selections automatically extend to column that contains selected cell.  (Applet only) - Browse: user can only browse grid data.  (Applet only)

maxrows.name: maxrows
maxrows.help: Maximum number of rows to display in grid.

notsupported.name: notsupported
notsupported.help: Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.
notsupported.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

picturebar.name: picturebar
picturebar.help: Yes: images for Insert, Delete, Sort buttons

insertbutton.name: insertbutton
insertbutton.help: Text for the insert button. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit".

deletebutton.name: deletebutton
deletebutton.help: Text of Delete button text. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit".

style.name: style
style.help: Flash only: Must be a style specification in CSS format. Ignored for type="text".

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. Default: true

visible.name: visible
visible.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true

tooltip.name: tooltip
tooltip.help: Flash only: text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

onchange.name: onchange
onchange.help: Flash only: ActionScript to run when the control changes due to user action in the control.

bindonload.name: bindonload
bindonload.help: *  yes: executes the bind attribute expression when first loading the form. * no: does not execute the bind attribute expression until the first bound event. Ignored if there is no bind attribute.

selectonload.name: selectonload
selectonload.help: *  yes: selects the first row of the grid when the gird loads. * no: does not select any rows when the grid loads.

onblur.name: onblur
onblur.help: ActionScript that runs when the grid loses focus.

onfocus.name: onfocus
onfocus.help: ActionScript that runs when the grid gets focus.

collapsible.name: collapsible
collapsible.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the user can collapse the entire grid by clicking an arrow on the title bar.

groupfield.name: groupfield
groupfield.help: Puts the grid rows into groups, organized by the column specified in this attribute. Each group is collapsible and has a header with the column name, group field value, and number of entries in the group.

onLoad.name: onLoad
onLoad.help: Java Script funtion that gets called when a grid is loaded for first time

multiRowSelect.name: multiRowSelect
multiRowSelect.help: If set to true, a checkbox appears as the first column of the grid. It lets users select multiple records.

cfgrid.name: cfgrid
cfgrid.help: Used within the cfform tag. Puts a grid control (a table of data) in a CFML form. To specify grid columns and row data, use the cfgridcolumn and cfgridrow tags, or use the query attribute, with or without cfgridcolumn tags.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of grid element.

bind.name: bind
bind.help: A bind expression specifying used to fill the contents of the grid. Cannot be used with the query attribute.

pagesize.name: pagesize
pagesize.help: The number of rows to display per page for a dynamic grid. If the number of available rows exceeds the page size, the grid displays only the specified number of entries on a single page, and the user navigates between pages to show all data. The grid retrieves data for each page only when it is required for display. This attribute is ignored if you specify a query attribute.

striperowcolor.name: striperowcolor
striperowcolor.help: The color to use for one of the alternating stripes. The bgColor setting determines the other color

preservepageonsort.name: preservepageonsort
preservepageonsort.help: Specifies whether to display the page with the current page number, or display page 1, after sorting (or resorting) the grid

striperows.name: striperows
striperows.help: Specifies whether to display the page with the current page number, or display page 1, after sorting (or resorting) the grid

format.name: format
format.help: - applet: generates a Java applet. - Flash: generates a Flash grid control. - xml: generates an XMLrepresentation of the grid. In XML format forms, includes the generated XML in the form. In HTML format forms, puts the XML in a string variable with the name specified by the name attribute. Default: applet

height.name: height
height.help: Control's height, in pixels. Default for applet: 300

width.name: width
width.help: Control's width, in pixels. Default for applet: 300

autowidth.name: autowidth
autowidth.help: Yes: sets column widths so that all columns display within grid width. No: sets columns to equal widths. User can resize columns. Horizontal scroll bars are not available, because if you specify a column width and set autoWidth = "Yes", CFML sets to this width, if possible

vspace.name: vspace
vspace.help: Vertical margin above and below control, in pixels.

hspace.name: hspace
hspace.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of control, in pixels.

align.name: align
align.help: Alignment of the grid cell contents

query.name: query
query.help: Name of query associated with grid control.

insert.name: insert
insert.help: User can insert row data in grid. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit"

delete.name: delete
delete.help: User can delete row data from grid. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit"

sort.name: sort
sort.help: The sort button performs simple text sort on column. User can sort columns by clicking column head or by clicking sort buttons. Not valid with selectmode=browse.  Yes: sort buttons display on grid control

italic.name: italic
italic.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

bold.name: bold
bold.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

textcolor.name: textcolor
textcolor.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

href.name: href
href.help: URL or query column name that contains a URL to hyperlink each grid column with.

hrefkey.name: hrefkey
hrefkey.help: The query column to use for the value appended to the href URL of each column, instead of the column's value.

target.name: target
target.help: Frame in which to open link specified in href.

appendkey.name: appendkey
appendkey.help: When used with href, passes CFTREEITEMKEY variable with the value of the selected tree item in URL to the application page specified in the cfform action attribute

highlighthref.name: highlighthref
highlighthref.help: Yes: Highlights links that are associated with a cftreeitem with a URL attribute value. No: Disables highlight.

onvalidate.name: onvalidate
onvalidate.help: JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to the specified routine, which should return True if validation succeeds; False, otherwise.

onerror.name: onerror
onerror.help: JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

multiRowSelect.name: multiRowSelect

cfgridcolumn (name).name: cfgridcolumn
cfgridcolumn (name).help: Used with the cfgrid tag in a cfform. Use this tag to specify column data in a cfgrid control. The font and alignment attributes used in cfgridcolumn override global font or alignment settings defined in cfgrid.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of grid column element. If grid uses a query, column name must specify name of a query column.

header.name: header
header.help: Column header text. Used only if cfgrid colHeaders = "Yes".

width.name: width
width.help: Column width, in pixels.

italic.name: italic
italic.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

bold.name: bold
bold.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

bgcolor.name: bgcolor
bgcolor.help: Background color of control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

textcolor.name: textcolor
textcolor.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

href.name: href
href.help: URL o r query column name that contains a URL to hyperlink each grid column with.

hrefkey.name: hrefkey
hrefkey.help: The query column to use for the value appended to the href URL of each column, instead of the column's value.

target.name: target
target.help: Frame in which to open link specified in href.

select.name: select
select.help: Yes: user can select the column in grid control.

type.name: type
type.help: image: grid displays image that corresponds to value in column (a built-in CFML image name, or an image in cfide\classes directory or subdirectory referenced with relative URL). If image is larger than column cell, it is clipped to fit. Built-in image names

headeritalic.name: headeritalic
headeritalic.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

headerbold.name: headerbold
headerbold.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

headertextcolor.name: headertextcolor
headertextcolor.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

numberformat.name: numberformat
numberformat.help: Format for displaying numeric data in grid. See numberFormat mask characters.

values.name: values
values.help: Formats cells in column as drop-down list boxes; specify items in drop-down list. Example: values = "arthur, scott, charles, 1-20, mabel"

valuesdisplay.name: valuesdisplay
valuesdisplay.help: Maps elements in values attribute to string to display in drop-down list. Delimited strings and/or numeric range(s).

valuesdelimiter.name: valuesdelimiter
valuesdelimiter.help: Maps elements in values attribute to string to display in drop-down list. Delimited strings and/or numeric range(s).

mask.name: mask
mask.help: A mask pattern that controls the character pattern that the form displays or allows users to input and sends to ColdFusion. For currency type data, use currency symbol. For text or numeric type data use: - A = [A-Za-z] - X = [A-Za-z0-9] - 9 = [0-9] - ? = Any character - all other = the literal character For date type data use datetime masks.

autoExpand.name: autoExpand
autoExpand.help: On a particualr column, it lets you expand the specified column. Setting autoExpand for multiple columns results in error. By default, autoExpand is set to true for the first column and false for the remaining columns. If the attribute display is false, autoExpand cannot be true; else, it results in error.

headerMenu.name: headerMenu
headerMenu.help: This attribute allows you to turn on/off the header menu of the grid column. Header menu is the dropdown list that appears when you hover the mouse on grid header columns.This is helpful in scenarios where you have images for grid headers.

cfgridcolumn.name: cfgridcolumn
cfgridcolumn.help: Used with the cfgrid tag in a cfform. Use this tag to specify column data in a cfgrid control. The font and alignment attributes used in cfgridcolumn override global font or alignment settings defined in cfgrid.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of grid column element. If grid uses a query, column name must specify name of a query column.

header.name: header
header.help: Column header text. Used only if cfgrid colHeaders = "Yes".

width.name: width
width.help: Column width, in pixels.

italic.name: italic
italic.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

bold.name: bold

valuesdisplay.help: Maps elements in values attribute to string to display in drop-down list. Delimited strings and/or numeric range(s).

valuesdelimiter.name: valuesdelimiter
valuesdelimiter.help: Maps elements in values attribute to string to display in drop-down list. Delimited strings and/or numeric range(s).

mask.help: A mask pattern that controls the character pattern that the form displays or allows users to input and sends to ColdFusion. For currency type data, use currency symbol. For text or numeric type data use: - A = [A-Za-z] - X = [A-Za-z0-9] - 9 = [0-9] - ? = Any character - all other = the literal character For date type data use datetime masks.

autoExpand.help: On a particualr column, it lets you expand the specified column. Setting autoExpand for multiple columns results in error. By default, autoExpand is set to true for the first column and false for the remaining columns. If the attribute display is false, autoExpand cannot be true; else, it results in error.

headerMenu.name: headerMenu
headerMenu.help: This attribute allows you to turn on/off the header menu of the grid column. Header menu is the dropdown list that appears when you hover the mouse on grid header columns.This is helpful in scenarios where you have images for grid headers.

cfgridrow (data).name: cfgridrow
cfgridrow (data).help: Lets you define a cfgrid that does not use a query as source for row data. If a query attribute is specified in cfgrid, the cfgridrow tags are ignored.

data.name: data
data.help: Delimited list of column values. If a value contains a comma, it must be escaped with another comma

delimiter.name: delimiter
delimiter.help: Delimiter to be used for data

cfgridrow.name: cfgridrow
cfgridrow.help: Lets you define a cfgrid that does not use a query as source for row data. If a query attribute is specified in cfgrid, the cfgridrow tags are ignored.

data.name: data
data.help: Delimited list of column values. If a value contains a comma, it must be escaped with another comma

delimiter.name: delimiter
delimiter.help: Delimiter to be used for data

cfgridupdate (grid).name: cfgridupdate
cfgridupdate (grid).help: Used within a cfgrid tag. Updates data sources directly from edited grid data. This tag provides a direct interface with your data source.  This tag applies delete row actions first, then insert row actions, then update row actions. If it encounters an error, it stops processing rows.

grid.name: grid
grid.help: Name of cfgrid form element that is the source for the update action.

datasource.name: datasource
datasource.help: Name of data source for the update action.

tablename.name: tablename
tablename.help: Table in which to insert form fields.  ORACLE drivers: must be uppercase. Sybase driver: case-sensitive. Must be the same case used when table was created

username.name: username
username.help: Overrides username specified in ODBC setup.

password.name: password
password.help: Overrides password specified in ODBC setup.

tablequalifier.name: tablequalifier
tablequalifier.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers, use this field to specify qualifier for table. The purpose of table qualifiers varies among drivers. For SQL Server and Oracle, qualifier refers to name of database that contains table. For Intersolv dBASE driver, qualifier refers to directory where DBF files are located.

keyonly.name: keyonly
keyonly.help: Applies to the update action: Yes: the WHERE criteria are limited to the key values No: the WHERE criteria include key values and the original values of changed fields

clientinfo.name: clientinfo
clientinfo.help: Struct that contains Clientinfo properties to be set on the database connection
