If this attribute is false, ColdFusion stops downloading all enclosures and generates an error when it encounters an error downloading an enclosure. Note: Enclosure errors can occur if the specified enclosure is of a type that the web server does not allow to be downloaded. (optional, default=false)

name.name: name
name.help: A structure that contains complete feed data: The output of a read action. The input definition of the feed to create. This structure contains complete feed information. When you specify the name attribute for a create action, you must put it in pound signs (#). (optional)

outputFile.name: outputFile
outputFile.help: Path of the file in which to write the feed as XML text. The path can be absolute, or relative to the CFML file. (optional)

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: Whether to overwrite the XML feed file if it already exists. If you do not set this attribute to true and the cffeed tag tries to write to a file that exists, ColdFusion generates an error. (optional, default=false)

overwriteEnclosure.name: overwriteEnclosure
overwriteEnclosure.help: Used only for the read action. Whether to overwrite files in the enclosure directory if they already exist. If you do not set this attribute to true and the cffeed tag tries to write to a file that exists, ColdFusion generates an error. (optional, default=false)

properties.name: properties
properties.help: A structure containing the feed metadata, the information about the entire feed. Can contain either of the following: The output of a read action. Input to a create action. The properties and query attributes combined provide complete feed information. When you specify the properties attribute for a create action, you must put it in pound signs (#) (optional)

query.name: query
query.help: A query object containing the Atom entries or RSS items in the feed. Can contain either of the following: The output of a read action. Input to a create action. The properties and query attributes combined provide complete feed information. When you specify the query attribute for a create action, you must put it in pound signs (#) (optional)

source.name: source
source.help: Used only for the read action. The URL of the feed or the path to the XML file that contains the feed contents. A path can be absolute, or relative to the CFML file. (required)

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: The number of seconds to wait for a response from the feed source. A value of 0 specifies that the request does not time out.

proxyServer.name: proxyServer
proxyServer.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server to which to send the request.

xmlvar.name: xmlvar
xmlvar.help: A variable in which to save the read or created feed as XML text.

proxyPort.name: proxyPort
proxyPort.help: The port to connect to on the proxy server.

proxyPassword.name: proxyPassword
proxyPassword.help: Password required by the proxy server.

userAgent.name: userAgent
userAgent.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.

proxyUser.name: proxyUser
proxyUser.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.

escapeChars.name: escapeChars
escapeChars.help: Escapes invalid utf8 chars when set to true

cfimage.name: cfimage
cfimage.help: Creates a ColdFusion image that can be manipulated by using Image functions. You can use the cfimage tag to perform common image manipulation operations as a shortcut to Image functions. You can use the cfimage tag independently or in conjunction with Image functions.

action.name: action
action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: border captcha convert info read resize rotate write writeToBrowser You do not need to specify the default action, read, explicitly. (optional, default=read)

angle.name: angle
angle.help: Angle in degrees to rotate the image. You must specify an integer for the value. (required)

color.name: color
color.help: (border) Border color. Hexadecimal value or supported named color. For a hexadecimal value, use the form "##xxxxxx" or "xxxxxx". (required)

destination.name: destination
destination.help: Absolute or relative pathname where the image output is written. The image format is determined by the file extension. The convert and write actions require a destination. The border, captcha, resize, and rotate actions require either a name attribute or a destination attribute. You can specify both. Scorpio supports only CAPTCHA images in PNG format. If you do not enter a destination, the CAPTCHA image is placed inline in the HTML output and displayed in the web browser. (optional)

difficulty.name: difficulty
difficulty.help: Level of complexity of the CAPTCHA text. Specify one of the following levels of text distortion: high medium low (optional, default=low)

fontSize.name: fontSize
fontSize.help: Font size of the text in the CAPTCHA image. The value must be an integer. (optional)

format.name: format
format.help: Format of the image displayed in the browser. If you do not specify a format, the image is displayed in PNG format. You cannot display a GIF image in a browser. GIF images are displayed in PNG format. (optional, Default=PNG)

height.name: height
height.help: Height in pixels of the image. For the resize attribute, you also can specify the height as a percentage (an integer followed by the "%" symbol). The value must be an integer. (optional)

isBase64.name: isBase64
isBase64.help: Specifies whether the source is a Base64 string. The isBase64 values are: yes: the source is a Base64 string. no: the source is not a Base64 string. (optional, default=no)

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the ColdFusion image variable.

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: Valid only if the destination attribute is specified. The overwrite values are: yes: overwrites the destination file. no: does not overwrite the destination file. If the destination file already exists, ColdFusion generates an error if the overwrite option is not set to yes. (optional, default=no)

quality.name: quality
quality.help: Quality of the JPEG destination file. Applies only to files with an extension of JPG or JPEG. Valid values are fractions that range from 0 through 1 (the lower the number, the lower the quality). (optional, default=0.75)

source.name: source
source.help: URL of the source image; for example, "http://www.google.com/ images/logo.gif" Absolute or relative pathname of the source image; for example, "c:\wwwroot\images\logo.jpg" ColdFusion image variable containing another image, BLOB, or byte array; for example, "#myImage#" Base64 string; for example, "data:image/jpg;base64,/9j/ 4AAQSkZJRgABAQA.............." (required)

structName.name: structName
structName.help: () Name of the ColdFusion structure to be created. (required)

text.name: text
text.help: Text string displayed in the CAPTCHA image. Use capital letters for better readability. (required)

thickness.name: thickness
thickness.help: Border thickness in pixels. The border is added to the outside edge of the source image, increasing the image area accordingly. The value must be an integer. (optional, default=1)

width.name: width
width.help: Width in pixels of the image. For resize, you also can specify the width as a percentage (an integer followed by the "%" symbol). The value must be an integer. (required)

fonts.name: fonts
fonts.help: One or more valid fonts to use for the CAPTCHA text. Separate multiple fonts with commas. ColdFusion supports only the system fonts that the JDK can recognize.

interpolation.name: interpolation
interpolation.help: Indicates algorithm to use when resizing the image. The default is highestQuality.

cfinterface.name: cfinterface
cfinterface.help: Defines an interface that consists of a set of signatures for functions. The interface does not include the full function definitions; instead, you implement the functions in a CFC. The interfaces that you define by using this tag can make up the structure of a reusable application framework.

displayName.name: displayName
displayName.help: A value to be displayed when using introspection to show a descriptive name for the interface. (optional)

extends.name: extends
extends.help: A comma delimited list of one or more interfaces that this interface extends. Any CFC that implements an interface must also implement all the functions in the interfaces specified by this property. If an interface extends another interface, and the child interface specifies a function with the same name as one in the parent interface, both functions must have the same attribues; otherwise ColdFusion generates an error. (optional)

hint.name: hint
hint.help: Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the interface. The hint attribute value follows the syntax line in the function description. (optional)

cfpdf.name: cfpdf
cfpdf.help: Manipulates existing PDF documents. The following list describes some of the tasks you can perform with the cfpdf tag: Merge several PDF documents into one PDF document. Extract pages from multiple PDF documents and generate a new PDF document. Linearize multipage PDF documents for faster display. Encrypt or decrypt PDF files for security.

action.name: action
action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: addwatermark deletepages getinfo merge protect read removewatermark setinfo write (required)

ascending.name: ascending
ascending.help: Order in which the PDF files are sorted: yes: files are sorted in ascending order no: files are sorted in descending order (optional, default=no)

copyfrom.name: copyfrom
copyfrom.help: The filename of the PDF document from which to copy the watermark (optional)

destination.name: destination
destination.help: The pathname of the modified PDF document. If the destination file exists, you must set the overwrite attribute to yes. If the destination file does not exist, ColdFusion creates it as long as the parent directory exists. (optional)

directory.name: directory
directory.help: Specify the directory of the PDF documents to merge. You must specify either the directory or the source. If you specify the directory, you must also specify the order. (optional)

encrypt.name: encrypt
encrypt.help: Specify the type of encryption used on the source PDF document: RC4_40, RC4_128M, AES_128, none (optional)

flatten.name: flatten
flatten.help: Specify whether the output file is flattened: yes: the formatting is removed and the file is flattened no: the format of the source PDF is maintained in the output file. (optional,default=no)

foreground.name: foreground
foreground.help: Specify whether the watermark is placed in the foreground of the PDF document: yes: the watermark appears in the foreground no: the watermark appears in the background (optional, default=no)

image.name: image
image.help: Specify the image used as a watermark. You can specify a filename or a ColdFusion image variable. (optional)

info.name: info
info.help: Specify the structure variable for relevant information, for example, #infoStruct#. ColdFusion ignores read only information, such as the creation date, application used to create the PDF document, and encryption parameters. (required)

isBase64.name: isBase64
isBase64.help: Specify whether the image used a watermark is in Base64 format: yes: the image is in Base64 format no: the image is not in Base64 format (optional, default=no)

keepbookmark.name: keepbookmark
keepbookmark.help: Specify whether bookmarks from the source PDF documents are retained in the merged document: yes: the bookmarks are retained no: the bookmarks are removed (optional, default=no)

name.name: name
name.help: Specify the PDF document variable name, for example, myPDFdoc. If the source is a PDF document variable, you cannot specify the name attribute again; you can write the modified PDF document to the destination. You can specify the destination attribute or 			the name attribute, but not both. For the processddx action, 			the name represents the structure that is populated 			with the success or failure of the output variables. 			For the readsignaturefields action, the name represents the structure 			thats is populated with the info of all the signature 			fields in the source PDF document. 			For the validatesignature option, the name attribute contains a Boolean field 			denoting the signature validity and an array containing 			the names of all the invalid signatures. (optional)

newOwnerPassword.name: newOwnerPassword
newOwnerPassword.help: Specify the password for the owner of the PDF document. (optional)

newUserPassword.name: newUserPassword
newUserPassword.help: Specify the password for the user of the PDF document. (optional)

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.help: Specify the opacity of the watermark. Valid values are integers in the range 0 (transparent) through 10 (opaque). (optional, default=3)

order.name: order
order.help: Specify the order in which the PDF documents in the directory are merged: name: orders the documents alphabetically time: orders the documents by timestamp (required)

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: Specify whether to overwrite the destination file: yes: overwrites the destination file no: does not overwrite the destination file (optional)

password.name: password
password.help: Specify the owner or user password of the source PDF document, if it exists. (optional)

permissions.name: permissions
permissions.help: Specify the type of permissions on the PDF document: AllowPrintHigh AllowPrintLow AllowModify AllowCopy AllowAdd AllowSecure AllowModifyAnnotations AllowExtract AllowFillIn all none Except for all or none, you can specify a commaseparated list of permissions. (optional)

position.name: position
position.help: Specify the position on the page    where the watermark is placed. The position represents the top-left corner of the watermark. Specify the x and y coordinates; for example 50,30. (optional)

rotation.name: rotation
rotation.help: Specify the degree of rotation of the watermark image on the page; for example, 30. (optional)

showonprint.name: showonprint
showonprint.help: Specify whether the watermark is printed with the PDF document: yes: the watermark is printed with the PDF document no: the watermark is not printed with the PDF document (optional)

source.name: source
source.help: Specify the source. The source can be: The pathname to a PDF document; for example, c:\work\myPDF.pdf A PDF document variable in memory that is generated by the cfdocument tag or the cfpdf tag; for example, #myPDFdoc# The binary content of PDF document variable. (required)

type.name: type
type.help: Specify the type to remove from the source PDF document: attachment bookmark watermark (optional)

version.name: version
version.help: (write) Specify the version of the PDF document to write. Valid values are: 1.1 1.2  1.3 1.4 1.5 1.6 (optional)

transparent.name: transparent
transparent.help: Specifies whether the image background is transparent or opaque: foormat=png only * yes: the background is transparent. * no: the background is opaque.

resolution.name: resolution
resolution.help: Image quality used to generate thumbnail images: * high: use high resolution (uses more memory). * low: use low resolution.

stoponerror.name: stoponerror
stoponerror.help: Valid only if the directory attribute is specified. If the specified directory contains files other then ColdFusion-readable PDF files, ColdFusion either stops merge process or continues. * yes: stops the merge process if invalid PDF files exist in the specified directory. * no: continues the merge process even if invalid files exist in the specified directory.

inputfiles.name: inputfiles
inputfiles.help: Structure that maps the PDF source files to the input variables in the DDX file, or a string of elements and their pathname.

scale.name: scale
scale.help: Size of the thumbnail relative to the source page. The value represents a percentage from 1 through 100.

imageprefix.name: imageprefix
imageprefix.help: Prefix used for each image thumbnail file generated. The image filenames use the format: imagePrefix_page_n.format.

outputfiles.name: outputfiles
outputfiles.help: Structure that contains the output files in the DDX file or string as keys and the pathname to the result file as the value.

pages.name: pages
pages.help: Page or pages in the source PDF document on which to perform the action. You can specify multiple pages and page ranges as follows: "1,6-9,56-89,100, 110-120".

ddxfile.name: ddxfile
ddxfile.help: Owner or user password of the source PDF document, if the document is password-protected.

saveoption.name: saveoption
saveoption.help: Save options for the PDF output: * full: normal save (default) * incremental: required to save modifications to a signed PDF document. * linear: for faster display.

format.name: format
format.help: File type of thumbnail image output: * jpg * tiff * png

hires.name: hires
hires.help: Sets a high resolution for the thumbnail if set to yes.

maxScale.name: maxScale
maxScale.help: Specifies the maximum scale of the thumbnail

maxBreadth.name: maxBreadth
maxBreadth.help: Specifies maximum width of the thumbnail

maxLength.name: maxLength
maxLength.help: Specifies the maximum length of the thumbnail

compressTIFFs.name: compressTIFFs
compressTIFFs.help: Compress thumbnail which are in TIFF format.

overridepage.name: overridepage
overridepage.help: Specify whether to override page or not

hScale.name: hScale
hScale.help: Horizontal scale of the image to be modified. Valid values are hscale

vScale.name: vScale
vScale.help: Vertical scale of the image to be modified. Valid values are vsacle

noAttachments.name: noAttachments
noAttachments.help: Removes all attachments from PDF documents.

noJavaScripts.name: noJavaScripts
noJavaScripts.help: Remove all document level JavaScript actions

algo.name: algo
algo.help: Specifies the algorithm for image downsampling.

leftMargin.name: leftMargin
leftMargin.help: Specifies the value of the leftMargin

rightMargin.name: rightMargin
rightMargin.help: Specifies the value of the rightMargin

bottomMargin.name: bottomMargin
bottomMargin.help: Specifies the value of the bottomMargin

numberFormat.name: numberFormat
numberFormat.help: Specify the numbering format for PDF pages in the footer.

align.name: align
align.help: Aligns the header and footer in PDF.

honourspaces.name: honourspaces
honourspaces.help: Set this option to "true" if you need characters to be converted to spaces.

addQuads.name: addQuads
addQuads.help: Add the position or quadrants of the thumbnail

useStructure.name: useStructure
useStructure.help: Specify whether to use structure or not

encodeAll.name: encodeAll
encodeAll.help: Encode streams that are not encoded to optimize page content

charset.name: charset
charset.help: Charset to be used when extracting text from the PDF

keyalias.name: keyalias
keyalias.help: Alias of the private key in the keystore

signaturefieldname.name: signaturefieldname
signaturefieldname.help: Sign (or unsign) that particular field if signature field exists in the document

keypassword.name: keypassword
keypassword.help: The password corresponding to the given key alias

unsignall.name: unsignall
unsignall.help: Unsigns all the signature in the given document

height.name: height
height.help: Height of the signature field.

width.name: width
width.help: Width of the signature field.

cfpdfform.name: cfpdfform
cfpdfform.help: Manipulates existing Adobe Acrobat forms and Adobe LiveCycle forms. The following list describes some of the tasks you can perform with the cfpdfform tag: Embed an interactive Acrobat form or LiveCycle form within a PDF document. You use the cfpdfform tag to embed the PDF form within a cfdocument tag. Render an existing Acrobat form or LiveCycle form. This includes prefilling fields from a database or an XML data file and processing form data submitted via HTTP post or PDF format. Extract or prefill values in stored PDF forms and save the output to a file or use it to update a data source.

action.name: action
action.help: The action to perform on the source: populate read (required)

datafile.name: datafile
datafile.help: (populate read) Pathname for the XML data file. if action="populate", the data from this file populates the fields of the PDF form. if action="read", ColdFusion writes the data to this file. You can specify a pathname relative to the context root or a relative pathname. You must specify either the datafile attribute or the result attribute for the read action; you can specify both. (optional)

destination.name: destination
destination.help: (populate) Pathname for the output file. You can specify an absolute pathname or a pathname relative to the context root. The file extension must be PDF or XDP. The file extension determines the format of the file. (The XDP format applies only to LiveCycle forms.) If you do not specify the destination, ColdFusion displays the form in the browser. Do not specify the destination when you embed a form in a PDF document. (optional)

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: (populate, read) Overwrite the destination file (if action="populate) or the data file (if action="read"): yes no (optional)

overwritedata.name: overwritedata
overwritedata.help: Specifies whether to overwrite existing data in PDF form fields with data from the data source:  * yes: Overwrite existing data in the form fields with that from the data source. * no: Retain existing data in form fields and populate only those fields without data.

result.name: result
result.help: (read) ColdFusion structure that contains the form field values. You must specify the datafile attribute or the result attribute; you can specify both. (optional)

source.name: source
source.help: (populate, read) Pathname of the source PDF (absolute path or path relative to the context root) or byte array representing a PDF. (required)

xmldata.name: xmldata
xmldata.help: Pathname for the XML data file.  * If action="populate", the data from this file, XML object, or XML string populates the form fields. You can specify a pathname relative to the context root or a relative pathname. * If action="read", ColdFusion writes the data to the variable.

name.name: name
name.help: Specify the PDF document variable name, for example, myPDFdoc. If the source is a PDF document variable, you cannot specify the name attribute again; you can write the modified PDF document to the destination. (optional)

fdf.name: fdf
fdf.help: If set to true, the system creates FDF with subforms and params instead of an XML

fdfData.name: fdfData
fdfData.help: For populate, you specify the file name from where the FDF data will be imported. For read, you specify the file name where the FDF data will be exported.

cfpdfformparam (name).name: cfpdfformparam
cfpdfformparam (name).help: Provides additional information to the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfformparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdfform or cfpdfsubform tag. Use the cfpdfformparam tag to populate fields in a PDF form.

index.name: index
index.help: Specify the index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, the index value is used to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)

name.name: name
name.help: The field name on the PDF form. (requiredl)

value.name: value
value.help: The value associated with the field name. For interactive fields, specify a ColdFusion variable. (optional)

imagefield.name: imagefield
imagefield.help: Indicates if the parameter is an image

cfpdfformparam (value).name: cfpdfformparam
cfpdfformparam (value).help: Provides additional information to the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfformparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdfform or cfpdfsubform tag. Use the cfpdfformparam tag to populate fields in a PDF form.

index.name: index
index.help: Specify the index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, the index value is used to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)

name.name: name
name.help: The field name on the PDF form. (requiredl)

value.name: value
value.help: The value associated with the field name. For interactive fields, specify a ColdFusion variable. (optional)

imagefield.name: imagefield
imagefield.help: Indicates if the parameter is an image

cfpdfformparam.name: cfpdfformparam
cfpdfformparam.help: Provides additional information to the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfformparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdfform or cfpdfsubform tag. Use the cfpdfformparam tag to populate fields in a PDF form.

index.name: index
index.help: Specify the index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, the index value is used to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)

name.name: name
name.help: The field name on the PDF form. (requiredl)

value.name: value
value.help: The value associated with the field name. For interactive fields, specify a ColdFusion variable. (optional)

imagefield.name: imagefield
imagefield.help: Indicates if the parameter is an image

cfpdfparam (source).name: cfpdfparam
cfpdfparam (source).help: Provides additional information for the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag applies only to the  merge action of the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdf tag.

password.name: password
password.help: Specify the user or owner password, if the source PDF file is passwordprotected. (optional)

source.name: source
source.help: Specify the source PDF file to merge. (optional)

pages.name: pages
pages.help: Page or pages of the PDF source file to merge. You can specify a range of pages, for example, "1-5 ", or a comma-separated list of pages, for example, "1-5,9-10,18".

cfpdfparam.name: cfpdfparam
cfpdfparam.help: Provides additional information for the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag applies only to the  merge action of the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdf tag.

password.name: password
password.help: Specify the user or owner password, if the source PDF file is passwordprotected. (optional)

source.name: source
source.help: Specify the source PDF file to merge. (optional)

pages.name: pages
pages.help: Page or pages of the PDF source file to merge. You can specify a range of pages, for example, "1-5 ", or a comma-separated list of pages, for example, "1-5,9-10,18".

cfpdfsubform (name).name: cfpdfsubform
cfpdfsubform (name).help: Populates a subform within the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfsubform tag can be a child tag of the cfpdfform tag or nested in another cfpdfsubform tag.

index.name: index
index.help: Index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, ColdFusion uses the index value is to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the subform corresponding to subform name in the PDF form. (required)

cfpdfsubform.name: cfpdfsubform
cfpdfsubform.help: Populates a subform within the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfsubform tag can be a child tag of the cfpdfform tag or nested in another cfpdfsubform tag.

index.name: index
index.help: Index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, ColdFusion uses the index value is to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the subform corresponding to subform name in the PDF form. (required)

cfpresentation.name: cfpresentation
cfpresentation.help: Defines the look and feel of a dynamic slide presentation. Use the cfpresentation tag as the parent tag for one or more cfpresentationslide tags, where you define the content for the presentation.

backgroundColor.name: backgroundColor
backgroundColor.help: Specifies the background color of the presentation. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x727971)

control.name: control
control.help: Specifies the presentation control: normal brief (optional, default=normal)

controlLocation.name: controlLocation
controlLocation.help: Specifies the location of the presentation control: right left (optional, default= right)

directory.name: directory
directory.help: Specifies the directory where the presentation is saved. This can be absolute path or a path relative to the CFM page. ColdFusion automatically generates the files necessary to run the presentation, including: index.htm components.swf loadflash.js viewer.swf ColdFusion stores any data files in the presentation, including images, video clips, and SWF files referenced by the cfpresentationslide tags in a subdirectory called data. To run the presentation, open the index.htm file. If you do not specify a directory, the presentation runs in the client browser. (optional)

glowColor.name: glowColor
glowColor.help: Specifies the color used for glow effects on the buttons. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or AF; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x35D334)

initialTab.name: initialTab
initialTab.help: Specifies which tab will be on top when the presentation is displayed. This applies only when the control value is normal: outline search notes (optional, default=outline)

lightColor.name: lightColor
lightColor.help: Specifies the light color used for light-and shadow effects. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x4E5D60)

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: Specifies whether files in the directory are overwritten. Specify this attribute only when the you specify the directory. yes: overwrites files if they are already present no: create new files (optional, default=yes)

primaryColor.name: primaryColor
primaryColor.help: Specifies the primary color of the presentation. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or AF; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x6F8488)

shadowColor.name: shadowColor
shadowColor.help: Specifies the shadow color used for light-and shadow effects. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x000000)

showNotes.name: showNotes
showNotes.help: Specifies whether the notes tab is present: yes no (optional, default=no)

showOutline.name: showOutline
showOutline.help: Specifies whether the outline is present: yes no (optional, default=yes)

showSearch.name: showSearch
showSearch.help: Specifies whether the search tab is present: yes no (optional, default=yes)

textColor.name: textColor
textColor.help: Specifies the color for all the text in the presentation user interface. (optional, default=0xFFFFFF)

title.name: title
title.help: Specifies the title of the presentation. (optional)

authpassword.name: authpassword
authpassword.help: Sends a password to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header.

authuser.name: authuser
authuser.help: Sends a user name to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header.

autoplay.name: autoplay
autoplay.help: Specifies whether to play the presentation automatically: * true: the presentation automatically runs through the entire presentation at startup. * false: the user must click the Play button to start the presentation and click the Next button to advance to the next slide in the presentation.

loop.name: loop
loop.help: Specifies whether the presentation runs in a loop: * true: the presentation restarts automatically after it ends. * false: the user must click the Play button to restart the presentation.

proxypassword.name: proxypassword
proxypassword.help: Password required by the proxy server.

proxyuser.name: proxyuser
proxyuser.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.

proxyhost.name: proxyhost
proxyhost.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server to which to send the request.

proxyport.name: proxyport
proxyport.help: The port to connect to on the proxy server.

useragent.name: useragent
useragent.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.

cfpresentationslide.name: cfpresentationslide
cfpresentationslide.help: Creates a slide dynamically from an HTML source file, HTML and CFML code, or an SWF source file. If you do not specify a source file, you must include the HMTL or CFML code for the body of the slide within the cfpresentationslide tag. The cfpresentationslide is the child tag of the cfpresentation tag.

audio.name: audio
audio.help: Specifies the path of the audio file relative to the CFM page. The audio file must be an MP3 file. A slide cannot have both audio and video specified (optional)

bottomMargin.name: bottomMargin
bottomMargin.help: Specifies the bottom margin of the slide. (optional, default=0)

duration.name: duration
duration.help: Specifies the duration in seconds that the slide is played. (required)

notes.name: notes
notes.help: Specifies the notes used for the slide. (optional)

presenter.name: presenter
presenter.help: Specifies the presenter of the slide. A slide can have only one presenter. This name must match one of the presenter names in the cfpresenter tag. If no presenter is specified, it will take the first presenter specified in the presenter list. (optional)

rightMargin.name: rightMargin
rightMargin.help: Specifies the right margin of the slide. (optional, default=0)

scale.name: scale
scale.help: Specifies the scale used for the HTML content on the slide presentation. If the scale attribute is not specified and the content cannot fit in one slide, it will automatically be scaled down to fit on the slide. (optional, default=1.0)

src.name: src
src.help: HTML or SWF source files used as a slide. You can specify the following as the slide source: an absolute path a path relative to the CFM page a URL: you can specify the URL only if the source is an HTML file SWF files must be present on the system running ColdFusion and the path must either be an absolute path or path relative to the CFM page. If the src value is not specified, you must specify HTML/CFML code as the body. If you specify a source file and HTML /CFML, ColdFusion ignores the source file and displays the HTML/CFML in the slide. (optional)

title.name: title
title.help: Specifies the title of the slide. (required)

topMargin.name: topMargin
topMargin.help: Specifies the top margin of the slide. (optional, default=0)

video.name: video
video.help: Specifies the video file used for the presenter of the slide. If you specify video for the slide and an image for the presenter, the video is used instead of the image for the slide. You cannot specify both audio and video for a slide. The video must be an FLV file. (optional)

advance.name: advance
advance.help: Overrides the cfpresentation tag autoPlay attribute for the slide: * auto: after the slide plays, the presentation advances to the next slide automatically. This is the default value if cfpresentation autoPlay="yes". * never: after the slide plays, the presentation does not advance to the next slide until the user clicks the Next button. This is the default value if cfpresentation autoPlay="no". * click: after the slide plays, the presentation advances to the next slide if the user clicks anywhere in the main presentation area.

authpassword.name: authpassword
authpassword.help: Use to pass a password to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header.

authuser.name: authuser
authuser.help: Use to pass a user name to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header.

useragent.name: useragent
useragent.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Identifies the request client software.

slides.name: slides
slides.help: Used to specify the slide numbers required to export from ppt file

useexternalprogram.name: useexternalprogram
useexternalprogram.help: Flag to indicate if external program to be used to open presentation

cfpresenter (name).name: cfpresenter
cfpresenter (name).help: Describes a presenter in a slide presentation. A slide presentation can have multiple presenters. The presenters must be referenced from the slides defined by the cfpresentationslide tag.

biography.name: biography
biography.help: Specifies the biography of the presenter. (required)

email.name: email
email.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. (optional)

image.name: image
image.help: Specifies the path for the presenter's image in JPEG format. The JPG file must be relative to theCFM page. (optional)

name.name: name
name.help: Specifies the name of the presenter. (required)

logo.name: logo
logo.help: Specifies the path for the presenter's logo or the logo of the presenters organization. The logo must be in JPEG format. The file must be relative to the CFM page. (optional)

title.name: title
title.help: Specifies the title of the presenter. (optional)

cfpresenter.name: cfpresenter
cfpresenter.help: Describes a presenter in a slide presentation. A slide presentation can have multiple presenters. The presenters must be referenced from the slides defined by the cfpresentationslide tag.

biography.name: biography
biography.help: Specifies the biography of the presenter. (required)

email.name: email
email.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. (optional)

image.name: image
image.help: Specifies the path for the presenter's image in JPEG format. The JPG file must be relative to theCFM page. (optional)

name.name: name
name.help: Specifies the name of the presenter. (required)

logo.name: logo
logo.help: Specifies the path for the presenter's logo or the logo of the presenters organization. The logo must be in JPEG format. The file must be relative to the CFM page. (optional)

title.name: title
title.help: Specifies the title of the presenter. (optional)

cfthread.name: cfthread
cfthread.help: The cfthread tag enables multithreaded programming in ColdFusion. Threads are independent streams of execution, and multiple threads on a page can execute simultaneously and asynchronously, letting you perform asynchronous processing in CFML. CFML code within the cfthread tag body executes on a separate thread while the page request thread continues processing without waiting for the cfthread body to finish. You use this tag to run or end a thread, temporarily stop thread execution, or join together multiple threads.

action.name: action
action.help: The action to take, one of the following values: join Makes the current thread wait until the thread or threads specified in the name attribute complete processing, or until the period specified in the timeout attribute passes, before continuing processing. If you dont specify a timeout and thread you are joining to doesnt finish, the current thread also cannot finish processing. run Creates a thread and starts it processing. sleep Suspends the current threads processing for the time specified by the duration attribute. This action is useful if one thread must wait for another thread to do processing without joining the threads. terminate Stops processing of the thread specified in the name attribute. If you terminate a thread, the thread scope includes an ERROR metadata structure with information about the termination. (optional, default=run)

duration.name: duration
duration.help: (sleep) The number of milliseconds for which to suspend thread processing. (required)

name.name: name
name.help: The name of the thread to which the action applies: terminate The name of the thread to stop. join The name of the thread or threads to join to the current thread. To specify multiple threads, use a comma-delimited list. run The name to use to identify the thread being created. (required)

priority.name: priority
priority.help: The priority level at which to run the thread. The following values are valid: HIGH, LOW, NORMAL Higher priority threads get more processing time than lower priority threads. Page-level code, the code that is outside of cfthread tags, always has NORMAL priority. (optional, default=NORMAL)

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.help: The number of milliseconds that the current thread waits for the thread or threads being joined to finish. If any thread does not finish by the specified time, the current thread proceeds. If the attribute value is 0, the default, the current thread continues waiting until all joining threads finish. If the current thread is the page thread, the page continues waiting until the threads are joined, even if you specify a page timeout. (optional, default=0)

cfzip.name: cfzip
cfzip.help: Manipulates ZIP and JavaTM Archive (JAR) files. In addition to the basic zip and unzip functions, use the cfzip tag to delete entries from an archive, filter files, read files in binary format, list the contents of an archive, and specify an entrypath used in an executable JAR file.

action.name: action
action.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: delete list read readBinary unzip zip If you do not specify an action, ColdFusion applies the default action, zip. (optional)

charset.name: charset
charset.help: The character set used to translate the ZIP or JAR entry into a text string. Examples of character sets are: JIS RFC1345 UTF-16 (optional, default=encoding of the host machine)

destination.name: destination
destination.help: Destination directory where the ZIP or JAR file is extracted. (optional)

entrypath.name: entrypath
entrypath.help: Pathname on which the action is performed. (optional)

file.name: file
file.help: Absolute pathname of the file on which the action is performed. For example, the full pathname of the ZIP file: c:\temp\log.zip. If you do not specify the full pathname (for example, file="log.zip"), ColdFusion creates the file in a temporary directory. You can use the GetTempDirectory function to access the ZIP or JAR file. (required)

filter.name: filter
filter.help: File filter applied to the action. The action applies to all files in the pathname specified that match the filter. (optional)

name.name: name
name.help: Record set name in which the result of the list action is stored. The record set columns are: name: filename of the entry in the JAR file. For example, if the entry is help/docs/index.htm, the name is index.htm. directory: directory containing the entry. For the example above, the directory is help/docs. You can obtain the full entry name by concatenating directory and name. If an entry is at the root level, the directory is empty (''). size: uncompressed size of the entry, in bytes. compressedSize: compressed size of the entry, in bytes. type: type of entry (directory or file). dateLastModified: last modified date of the entry, cfdate object. comment: any comment, if present, for the entry. crc: crc-32 checksum of the uncompressed entry data. (required)

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: unzip: Specifies whether to overwrite the extracted files: yes: if the extracted file already exists at the destination specified, the file is overwritten. no: if the extracted file already exists at the destination specified, the file is not overwritten and that entry is not extracted. The remaining entries are extracted. zip: Specifies whether to overwrite the contents of a ZIP or JAR file: yes: overwrites all of the content in the ZIP or JAR file if it exists. no: updates existing entries and adds new entries to the ZIP or JAR file if it exists. (optional, default=no)

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.help: String added as a prefix to the ZIP or JAR entry. The string is the name of a subdirectory in which the entries are added. (optional)

recurse.name: recurse
recurse.help: Specifies whether the action applies to subdirectories: yes: includes subdirectories. no: does not include subdirectories. (optional, default=yes)

showDirectory.name: showDirectory
showDirectory.help: yes: lists the directories. no: does not list directories. (optional, default= no)

source.name: source
source.help: Source directory to be zipped. Not required if cfzipparam is specified. (required)

storePath.name: storePath
storePath.help: zip: Specifies whether pathnames are stored in the ZIP or JAR file: yes: pathnames of entries are stored in the ZIP or JAR file. no: pathnames of the entries are not stored in the ZIP or JAR file. All the files are placed at the root level. In case of a name conflict, the last file in the iteration is added. unzip: Specifies whether files are stored at the entrypath: yes: the files are extracted to the entrypath. no: the entrypath is ignored and all the files are extracted at the root level. (optional, default= yes)

variable.name: variable
variable.help: Variable in which the read content is stored. (required)

password.name: password
password.help: Password with which to archive the files

encryptionAlgorithm.name: encryptionAlgorithm
encryptionAlgorithm.help: Encryption algorithm to be used to encrypt the files when a password is given

cfzipparam.name: cfzipparam
cfzipparam.help: Provides additional information to the cfzip tag. The cfzipparam tag is always a child tag of the cfzip tag.

charset.name: charset
charset.help: Converts string content into binary data before putting it into a ZIP or JAR file. Used only when cfzip action="zip" and the cfzipparam content is a string. Examples of character sets are: JIS RFC1345 UTF-16 (optional, default=encoding of the host machine)

content.name: content
content.help: Content written to the ZIP or JAR entry. Used only when cfzip action="zip". Valid content data types are binary and string. If you specify the content attribute, you must specify the entrypath attribute. (optional)

entrypath.name: entrypath
entrypath.help: Pathanme used: For cfzip action="zip", it is the entrypath used. This is valid only when the source is a file. The entrypath creates a subdirectory within the ZIP or JAR file. For cfzip action="unzip", it is the pathname to unzip. For cfzip action="delete", it is the pathname to delete from the ZIP or JAR file. (optional)

filter.name: filter
filter.help: File filter applied to the action. For example, for the zip action, all the files in the source directory matching the filter are zipped. (optional)

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.help: String added as a prefix to the ZIP or JAR entry. Used only when cfzip action="zip". (optional)

recurse.name: recurse
recurse.help: Recurse the directory to be zipped, unzipped, or deleted, as specified by the cfzip parent tag. (optional, default=yes)

source.name: source
source.help: Source directory or file. Used only when cfzip action="zip". Specified file(s) are added to the ZIP or JAR file: If you specify source attribute for the cfzip tag, the cfzipparam source is relative to it. If you do not specify a source attribute for the cfzip tag, the cfzipparam source must be an absolute path. (optional)

password.name: password
password.help: Password with which to archive the files

encryptionAlgorithm.name: encryptionAlgorithm
encryptionAlgorithm.help: Encryption algorithm to be used to encrypt the files when a password is given

width.name: width
width.help: Width in pixel. Default='300'

height.name: height
height.help: Height in pixel.

bind.name: bind
bind.help: A bind expression specifying a client JavaScript function or server CFC that the control calls to get progress information each time the period defined by the interval attribute elapses. You cannot use this attribute with a duration attribute.

oncomplete.name: oncomplete
oncomplete.help: This function will be called by CF once work is done. This can be used to reset status of progress bar text or enabling the button, which might be in disable mode while task was under progress or something more.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the progressBar.

duration.name: duration
duration.help: If callback is not defined then based on this value, ColdFusion will decide percentage work done. One of the callback or totaltime attribute needs to be defined.

interval.name: interval
interval.help: Time interval on which progressbar will keep on updating.

style.name: style
style.help: The following are the supported styles:• bgcolor: The background color for the progress bar. A hexadecimal value without “#” prefixed. textcolor: Text color on progress bar. progresscolor: Color used to indicate the progress

autoDisplay.name: autoDisplay
autoDisplay.help: Set to true to display the progress bar.

onError.name: onError
onError.help: The JavaScript function to run on an error condition. The error can be a network error or server-side error.

width.name: width
width.help: Width in pixel. Default='300'

height.name: height
height.help: Height in pixel.

bind.name: bind
bind.help: A bind expression specifying a client JavaScript function or server CFC that the control calls to get progress information each time the period defined by the interval attribute elapses. You cannot use this attribute with a duration attribute.

oncomplete.name: oncomplete
oncomplete.help: This function will be called by CF once work is done. This can be used to reset status of progress bar text or enabling the button, which might be in disable mode while task was under progress or something more.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the progressBar.

duration.name: duration
duration.help: If callback is not defined then based on this value, ColdFusion will decide percentage work done. One of the callback or totaltime attribute needs to be defined.

interval.name: interval
interval.help: Time interval on which progressbar will keep on updating.

style.name: style
style.help: The following are the supported styles:• bgcolor: The background color for the progress bar. A hexadecimal value without “#” prefixed. textcolor: Text color on progress bar. progresscolor: Color used to indicate the progress

autoDisplay.name: autoDisplay
autoDisplay.help: Set to true to display the progress bar.

onError.name: onError
onError.help: The JavaScript function to run on an error condition. The error can be a network error or server-side error.

password.name: password
password.help: Set a password for modifying the sheet.

action.name: action
action.help: One of the following: • read - Reads the contents of an XLS format file. • update - Adds a new sheet to an existing XLS file. You cannot use the uppdate 		action to change an existing sheet in a file. For more information, see Usage. • write - Writes a new XLS format file or overwrites an existing file.

rows.name: rows
rows.help: The range of rows to read. Specify a single number, a hypen-separated row range, a comma-separated list, or any combination of these; for example: 1,3-6,9.

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to overwrite an existing file.

src.name: src
src.help: The pathname of the file to read.

filename.name: filename
filename.help: The pathname of the file that is written.

columns.name: columns
columns.help: Column number or range of columns. Specify a single number, a hypen-separated column range, a comma-separated list, or any combination of these; for example: 1,3-6,9.

query.name: query
query.help: • read action: The query in which to store the converted spreadsheet file. You must specify format, name , or query. • write and update actions: A query variable containing the data to write. You must specify name or query.

headerrow.name: headerrow
headerrow.help: Row number that contains column names.

name.name: name
name.help: read action: The variable in which to store the spreadsheet file data. You must specify name or query.if format='csv' then name will contain csv variable. if format='html' then name will contain html content. write and update actions: A variable containing CSV-format data or an ColdFusion spreadsheet object containing the data to write. You must specify name or query.

format.name: format
format.help: Format of the data represented by the name variable.

excludeheaderrow.name: excludeheaderrow
excludeheaderrow.help: If set to true, excludes the header row from being included in the query results.

autosize.name: autosize
autosize.help: If false, all comuns of sheets will not be resized.

cfmediaplayer.name: cfmediaplayer
cfmediaplayer.help: Creates an in-built media player that lets you play Flash and videos formats supported by HTML5

width.name: width
width.help: Width of the media player, in pixels.

height.name: height
height.help: Height of the media player, in pixels.

hideBorder.name: hideBorder
hideBorder.help: A Boolean value that specifies if you want to hide border for the media player panel

controlbar.name: controlbar
controlbar.help: A Boolean value that specifies if you want to display the control panel for the media player

align.name: align
align.help: Specifies the vertical alignment of the media player.

onload.name: onload
onload.help: Custom JavaScript function to run on loading the player component.

bgcolor.name: bgcolor
bgcolor.help: The background color of the media player specified as a Hexadecimal value without a "#"

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the media player. The name attribute is required when you invoke JavaScript functions.

quality.name: quality
quality.help: The quality of the media playback

hideTitle.name: hideTitle
hideTitle.help: A Boolean value that specifies if you want to hide title for the media player panel

oncomplete.name: oncomplete
oncomplete.help: Custom JavaScript function to run when the video has finished playing

onstart.name: onstart
onstart.help: Custom JavaScript function to run when the video starts playing

wmode.name: wmode
wmode.help: Specifies the absolute positioning and layering capabilities in your browser

autoPlay.name: autoPlay
autoPlay.help: A Boolean value that specifies if the media player should automatically play the video on loading the page

style.name: style
style.help: Specify style for mediaplayer

type.name: type
type.help: Specifies playback type

repeat.name: repeat
repeat.help: If true, playback repeats after finishing the current playback

posterImage.name: posterImage
posterImage.help: Path or URL of the image that needs to be displayed over the player before starting playback

skin.name: skin
skin.help: Path to the XML in which skinning options are specified

title.name: title
title.help: Title of the media being played

onerror.name: onerror
onerror.help: Name of Javascript function to be invoked when playback throws an error

onpause.name: onpause
onpause.help: Name of Javascript function should be invoked when player is paused

url.name: url
url.help: The URL to the server where the files are uploaded.

width.name: width
width.help: Width of the file upload control, in pixels.

extensionfilter.name: extensionfilter
extensionfilter.help: Use this attribute to specify the type of file that you will allow to be uploaded. For example, to let only image files to be uploaded, you can specify file extensions like .jpg, .jpeg, or .png

progressbar.name: progressbar
progressbar.help: Whether to display Progress Bar or not. Default true

height.name: height
height.help: Height of the file upload control, in pixels.

maxUploadSize.name: maxUploadSize
maxUploadSize.help: The maximum file size, in mega bytes, allowed for the upload. Default 10MB.

maxFileSelect.name: maxFileSelect
maxFileSelect.help: The maximum number of files allowed for the upload.

style.name: style
style.help: A CSS style specification that defines layout styles

bgcolor.name: bgcolor
bgcolor.help: The background color for the file upload control. A hexadecimal value without “#” prefixed.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the file upload component.

oncomplete.name: oncomplete
oncomplete.help: The JavaScript function to run after the file upload completes

onerror.name: onerror
onerror.help: The JavaScript function to run on an error condition. The error can be a network error or server-side error

wmode.name: wmode
wmode.help: Specifies the absolute positioning and layering capabilities in your browser:

stopOnError.name: stopOnError
stopOnError.help: Specifies whether or not to ignore the exceptions for this operation. When the value is true, it stops uploading, displays an appropriate error

hideUploadButton.name: hideUploadButton
hideUploadButton.help: A Boolean value that specifies if the Upload button should appear in the media player

onUploadComplete.name: onUploadComplete
onUploadComplete.help: The JavaScript function to run after the all uploads have completed

cfsharepoint (action).name: cfsharepoint
cfsharepoint (action).help: Invokes a feature that SharePoint exposes as a web service action, such as the Document Workspace getdwsdata action.

password.name: password
password.help: The password required to connect to the SharePoint server. Required if you do not specify a login attribute.

action.name: action
action.help: The name of a web service action. See Usage for the list of service actions you can specify.

login.name: login
login.help: A structure containing user, password, and domain login credentials to pass to the service. If you do not specify domain ,password, and userNameattributes you must specify a login structure with domain, password, and userName entries.

params.name: params
params.help: A structure containing names and values of the parameters to pass to the service.

domain.name: domain
domain.help: The domain name required to connect to the SharePoint server. Required if you do not specify a login attribute.

username.name: username
username.help: The user name required to connect to the SharePoint server. Required if you do not specify a login attribute.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the result variable in which to put the data returned by the SharePoint service.

wsdl.name: wsdl
wsdl.help: Path to the service wsdl file. Required to invoke an action that is not in the list of supported actions. See Usage for details.

cfsharepoint.name: cfsharepoint
cfsharepoint.help: Invokes a feature that SharePoint exposes as a web service action, such as the Document Workspace getdwsdata action.

password.name: password
password.help: The password required to connect to the SharePoint server. Required if you do not specify a login attribute.

action.name: action
action.help: The name of a web service action. See Usage for the list of service actions you can specify.

login.name: login
login.help: A structure containing user, password, and domain login credentials to pass to the service. If you do not specify domain ,password, and userNameattributes you must specify a login structure with domain, password, and userName entries.

params.name: params
params.help: A structure containing names and values of the parameters to pass to the service.

domain.name: domain
domain.help: The domain name required to connect to the SharePoint server. Required if you do not specify a login attribute.

username.name: username
username.help: The user name required to connect to the SharePoint server. Required if you do not specify a login attribute.

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the result variable in which to put the data returned by the SharePoint service.

wsdl.name: wsdl
wsdl.help: Path to the service wsdl file. Required to invoke an action that is not in the list of supported actions. See Usage for details.

cfmapitem (name).name: cfmapitem
cfmapitem (name).help: This tag creates markers on the map.

longitude.name: longitude
longitude.help: The longitude value for the marker, in degrees.

address.name: address
address.help: The address of the location to set the map marker.

tip.name: tip
tip.help: A short description of the marker location that appears as a tool tip.

latitude.name: latitude
latitude.help: The latitude value for the marker, in degrees.

name.name: name
name.help: The name of the map.

showMarkerWindow.name: showMarkerWindow
showMarkerWindow.help: When true, the marker infowindow is shown. By default, this is false. This is inherited by all cfmapitem tags.

markerWindowContent.name: markerWindowContent
markerWindowContent.help: Static inner html markup to be displayed in the infowindow opened when the marker is clicked. This is mutually exclusive with the markerbind attribute

markerIcon.name: markerIcon
markerIcon.help: Location of an image file to use as the marker icon. The attributes markericon and markercolor are mutually exclusive.

markerColor.name: markerColor
markerColor.help: Indicates the color of the marker.

showmarkerwinodw.name: showmarkerwinodw
showmarkerwinodw.help: Flag to show/hide marker window at the location

showuser.name: showuser
showuser.help: If true, fetches the geo location of the user and adds marker at that location

cfmap.name: cfmap
cfmap.help: Embeds a Google map within a ColdFusion web page

width.name: width
width.help: Map width, in pixels.

centerlongitude.name: centerlongitude
centerlongitude.help: The longitude value for the location, in degrees

centeraddress.name: centeraddress
centeraddress.help: The address of the location, which is set as the center of the map.

continuouszoom.name: continuouszoom
continuouszoom.help: Whether to provide zoom control that enables smooth zooming for the map

type.name: type
type.help: Type of the Google map

tip.name: tip
tip.help: A short description of the center location that appears as a tool tip.

overview.name: overview
overview.help: Whether to add an Overview panel to the map

hideborder.name: hideborder
hideborder.help: Whether to hide border for surrounding panel

key.name: key
key.help: The API key of the map.

collapsible.name: collapsible
collapsible.help: Whether to provide a collapsible property for the surrounding panel

height.name: height
height.help: Height of the map, in pixels

centerlatitude.name: centerlatitude
centerlatitude.help: The latitude value for the location, in degrees.

onload.name: onload
onload.help: Custom JavaScript function that runs after the map loads..

typecontrol.name: typecontrol
typecontrol.help: What type of typecontrol to provide. Basic inclueds "map, satellite, hybrid" and Advanced includes "map, satellite, hybrid, earth, terrain"

name.name: name
name.help: Name of the map.

scrollwheelzoom.name: scrollwheelzoom
scrollwheelzoom.help: Whether to enable mouse wheel zooming control

markerBind.name: markerBind
markerBind.help: Uses a bind expression to fetch markup to be displayed in the infowindow opened when the marker is clicked. This is mutually exclusive with the markerwindowtext attribute. This is inherited by all cfmapitem tags

showMarkerWindow.name: showMarkerWindow
showMarkerWindow.help: When true, the marker infowindow is shown. By default, this is false. This is inherited by all cfmapitem tags.

markerWindowContent.name: markerWindowContent
markerWindowContent.help: Static inner html markup to be displayed in the infowindow opened when the marker is clicked. This is mutually exclusive with the markerbind attribute

markerIcon.name: markerIcon
markerIcon.help: Location of the icon to use for the marker.

onError.name: onError
onError.help: The JavaScript function to run when there is a Google map API error. The JavaScript function is passed with two parameters, Google map status code and error message.

showCenterMarker.name: showCenterMarker
showCenterMarker.help: Whether to display the marker icon that identifies the map center

showallmarkers.name: showallmarkers
showallmarkers.help: Flag to show or hide markers on the map

showmarkerwinodw.name: showmarkerwinodw
showmarkerwinodw.help: Flag to show marker at the center location in the map

showuser.name: showuser
showuser.help: If true, the tag finds the geo location of the user and map is centered at that location

initshow.name: initshow
initshow.help: Use this attribute to show a map on page load.

labelcancel.name: labelcancel
labelcancel.help: The text to put on the cancel button of a prompt message box.

callbackHandler.name: callbackHandler
callbackHandler.help: Callback function which will be called when any ok|no|cancel button is clicked

labelok.name: labelok
labelok.help: The text to put on a alert button and prompt messge box OK button.

title.help: The title for the message box.

type.name: type
type.help: Type of action to be performed

message.name: message

labelno.name: labelno
labelno.help: The text to put on the button used for a negative response in a confirm message box.

labelyes.name: labelyes

bodyStyle.name: bodyStyle

buttonType.name: buttonType

icon.name: icon
icon.help: Specifies the following CSS classes error: Provides the error icon. You can use this icon when displaying error messages. info: Provides the info icon. You can use this icon when displaying any information. question: Provides the question icon. You can use this icon in a confirmation message box that prompts a user response. warning: Provides the warning icon. You can use this icon when displaying a warning message

modal.name: modal

width.name: width
width.help: Width of the message box in pixels.

x.name: x
x.help: The X (horizontal) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the message box . ColdFusion ignores this attribute if you do not set the y attribute.

y.name: y
y.help: The Y (vertical) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the message box. ColdFusion ignores this attribute if you do not set the x attribute.

deviceTimeOut.name: deviceTimeOut
deviceTimeOut.help: Number of seconds to time out while checking whether the required plugins are loaded sucessfully. It is used when enableDeviceApi or detectDevice is enabled. Default value is 10 seconds.

image.name: image
