name: abs
help: Absolute-value function. The absolute value of a number is the number without its sign.

name: aCos
help: Returns the angle whose cosine is the value passed as the argument.

name: number
help: The value to be converted into an angle. Must be between -1 and 1.

name: ajaxLink
help: Causes an HTML href attribute to display link results in the current Ajax container.

name: url
help: The URL of the link.

name: ajaxOnLoad
help: Causes the specified JavaScript function to run when the page loads.

name: functionname
help: The name of the function to run when the page loads.

name: applicationStop
help: Stops current application

name: arrayContains
help: Returns true if specified object is present is given array

name: arrayDelete
help: Deletes specified object from given array

name: arrayMax
help: Returns the largest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

name: arrayMin
help: Returns the smallest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

name: arrayLen
help: Determines the number of elements in an array. CFML MX: this function can be used on child XML objects.

name: arrayAppend
help: Appends an array element to an array.

name: array
help: The array to which the element should be appended.

name: value
help: The element to append. Can be any type.

name: arrayconcat
help: If true adds array as one element, else adds individual elements. Default is false

name: arrayAvg
help: Calculates the average of the values in an array. All elements in the array must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric.

name: arrayClear
help: Removes all elements from an array.

name: arrayNew
help: Creates an array of 1-3 dimensions. Index array elements with square brackets: [ ]. CFML arrays expand dynamically as data is added.

name: arrayPrepend
help: Inserts an array element at the beginning of an array and shifts the positions of the existing elements to make room.

name: arrayResize
help: Resets an array to a specified minimum number of elements. This can improve performance, if used to size an array to its expected maximum. For more than 500 elements, use ArrayResize immediately after using the ArrayNew tag.

name: arraySet
help: In a one-dimensional array, sets the elements in a specified index range to a value. Useful for initializing an array after a call to ArrayNew.

name: arraySort
help: Sorts array elements numerically or alphanumerically.

name: array
help: Name of an array

name: sort_type
help: numeric: sorts numbers text: sorts text alphabetically, taking case into account (also known as case sensitive). All letters of one case precede the first letter of the other case: - aabzABZ, if sort_order = "asc" (ascending sort) - ZBAzbaa, if sort_order = "desc" (descending sort)  textnocase: sorts text alphabetically, without regard to case (also known as case-insensitive). A letter in varying cases precedes the next letter: - aAaBbBzzZ, in an ascending sort; preserves original intra-letter order - ZzzBbBaAa, in a descending sort; reverses original intra-letter order

name: sort_order
help: asc: ascending sort order. Default. - aabzABZ or aAaBbBzzZ, depending on value of sort_type, for letters - from smaller to larger, for numbers  desc: descending sort order. - ZBAzbaa or ZzzBbBaAa, depending on value of sort_type, for letters - from larger to smaller, for numbers

name: arraySum
help: The sum of values in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero.

name: arraySwap
help: Swaps array values of an array at specified positions. This function is more efficient than multiple cfset tags

name: arrayToList
help: Converts a one-dimensional array to a list.

name: asc
help: Determines the value of a character.

name: aSin
help: Determines the arcsine of a number. The arcsine is the angle whose sine is number.

name: atn
help: Arctangent function. The arctangent is the angle whose tangent is number.

name: binaryDecode
help: Converts a string to a binary object. Used to convert binary data that has been encoded into string format back into binary data.

name: String
help: A string containing encoded binary data.

name: binaryencoding
help: A string specifying the algorithm used to encode the original binary data into a string; must be one of the following: - hex: characters 0-9 and A-F represent the hexadecimal value of each byte; for example, 3A. - UU: data is encoded using the UNIX UUencode algorithm. - base64: data is encoded using the Base64 algorithm.

name: binaryEncode
help: Converts binary data to a string.

name: binarydata
help: A string containing encoded binary data.

name: encoding
help: A string specifying the encoding method to use to represent the data; one of the following: - hex: use characters 0-9 and A-F represent the hexadecimal value of each byte; for example, 3A. - UU: use the UNIX UUencode algorithm to convert the data. - base64: use the Base64 algorithm to convert the data.

name: bitAnd
help: Performs a bitwise logical AND operation.

name: bitMaskClear
help: Performs a bitwise mask clear operation.

name: bitMaskRead
help: Performs a bitwise mask read operation. Returns an integer, created from length bits of number, beginning at start.

name: bitMaskSet
help: Performs a bitwise mask set operation.

name: bitNOT
help: Performs a bitwise logical NOT operation.

name: bitOR
help: Performs a bitwise logical OR operation.

name: bitShln
help: Performs a bitwise shift-left, no-rotation operation.

name: bitShrn
help: Performs a bitwise shift-right, no-rotation operation.

name: bitXOR
help: Performs a bitwise logical XOR operation.

name: ceiling
help: Determines the closest integer that is greater than a specified number.

name: charsetDecode
help: Converts as string to a binary representation.

name: String
help: A string containing data to encode in binary format.

name: encoding
help: A string specifying encoding of the input data.

name: charsetEncode
help: Uses the specified encoding to convert binary data to a string.

name: binaryobject
help: A variable containing binary data to decode into text.

name: encoding
help: The character encoding that was used to encode the string into binary format.

name: chr
help: Converts a numeric value to a UCS-2 character.

name: cJustify
help: Centers a string in a field length.

name: compare
help: Performs a case-sensitive comparison of two strings. -1, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 1, if string1 is greater than string2

name: compareNoCase
help: Performs a case-insensitive comparison of two strings. An indicator of the difference: A negative number, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 A positive number, if string1 is greater than string2

name: cos
help: Calculates the cosine of an angle that is entered in radians. A number; the cosine of the angle.

name: createDate
help: Creates a date/time object

name: createDateTime
help: Creates a date-time object.

name: createObject
help: The CreateObject function takes different arguments depending on the value of the first argument:  CreateObject('com', class, context, serverName) CreateObject('component', component-name) CreateObject('corba', context, class, locale) CreateObject('java', class) CreateObject('webservice', urltowsdl, [, portname])

name: urltowsdl
help: WSDL file URL; location of web service

name: portname
help: The port name for the web service. This value is case-sensitive and corresponds to the port element's name attribute under the service element. Specify this parameter if the web service contains multiple ports. If no port name is specified, ColdFusion uses the first port found in the WSDL.

name: createODBCDate
help: Creates an ODBC date object.

name: createODBCDateTime
help: Creates an ODBC date-time object.

name: createODBCTime
help: Creates an ODBC time object.

name: createTime
help: Creates a time variable.

name: createTimespan
help: Creates a date/time object that defines a time period. You can add or subtract it from other date/time objects and use it with the cachedWithin attribute of cfquery.

name: createUUID
help: Creates a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID). A UUID is a 35-character string representation of a unique 128-bit integer xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx : x is a hexadecimal digit

name: dateAdd
help: Adds units of time to a date. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

name: dateCompare
help: Performs a full date/time comparison of two dates. -1, if date1 is less than date2 0, if date1 is equal to date2 1, if date1 is greater than date2 [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

name: dateConvert
help: Converts local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), or UTC to local time. The function uses the daylight savings settings in the executing computer to compute daylight savings time, if required. [type - quicky] local2Utc: Converts local time to UTC time. utc2Local: Converts UTC time to local time

name: dateDiff
help: Determines the integer number of units by which date1 is less than date2. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

name: dateFormat
help: Formats a date value using U.S. date formats. For international date support, use LSDateFormat. [mask - quicky] d,dd,ddd,dddd: Day of month / week m,mm,mmm,mmmm: Month; y,yy,yyyy: Year; gg: Period/era string short / medium / long / full

name: datePart
help: Extracts a part from a date value as a numeric. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

name: day
help: Determines the day of the month, in a date. The ordinal for the day of the month, ranging from 1 to 31.

name: dayOfWeek
help: Determines the day of the week, in a date.

name: dayOfWeekAsString
help: Determines the day of the week as a string from 1-7

name: dayOfYear
help: Determines the day of the year, in a date.

name: daysInMonth
help: Determines the number of days in a month.

name: daysInYear
help: Determines the number of days in a year.

name: de
help: Postpones evaluation of a string as an expression, when it is passed as a parameter to the IIf or Evaluate functions. Escapes any double quotation marks in the parameter and wraps the result in double quotation marks.

name: decimalFormat
help: Converts a number to a decimal-formatted string.

name: decrementValue
help: Decrements the integer part of a number.

name: decrypt
help: Decrypts a string that is encrypted with the Encrypt function.

name: encrypted_string
help: String to decrypt.

name: key
help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

name: algorithm
help: The algorithm to use to decrypt the string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

name: encoding
help: The binary encoding used to represent the data as a string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * Base64: the Base64 algorithm, as specified by IETF RFC 2045. * Hex: the characters A-F and 0-9 represent the hexadecimal byte values. * UU: the UNIX standard UUEncode algorithm (default). If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter.

name: ivorsalt
help: Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

name: iterations
help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

name: decryptBinary
help: Decrypts encrypted binary data with the specified key, value, algorithm, salt, and iterations.

name: bytes
help: Binary data to decrypt.

name: key
help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

name: algorithm
help: The algorithm to use to decrypt the string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

name: ivorsalt

If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

name: iterations
help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

name: deleteClientVariable
help: Deletes a client variable. (To test for the existence of a variable, use IsDefined.)

name: deserializeJSON
help: Converts a JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) string data representation into CFML data, such as a CFML structure or array.

name: stringToBeDeserialized
help: A string that contains a valid JSON construct, or variable that represents one.

name: strictmapping
help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to convert the JSON strictly.

name: usecustomserializer
help: Whether to use the customSerializer or not. The default value is true. Always the custom serializer will be used for deserialization. If specified false, the JSON deserialization will be done using the default ColdFusion behaviour.

name: directoryExists
help: Determines whether a directory exists.

name: directoryCreate
help: Creates new directory for specified path

name: directoryList
help: Lists the directory and returns the list of files under it as array or query

name: directoryDelete
help: Deltes directory for given path

name: directoryRename
help: Renames given directory

name: directorySize
help: Returns size of given directory

name: dollarFormat
help: Formats a string in U.S. format. (For other currencies, use LSCurrencyFormat or LSEuroCurrencyFormat.)

name: dotnetToCFType
help: Explicitly converts a value returned by a .NET method to the corresponding ColdFusion data type.

name: duplicate
help: Returns a clone, also known as a deep copy, of a variable or XML object. There is no reference to the original variable.

name: encrypt
help: Encrypts a string. Uses a symmetric key-based algorithm, in which the same key is used to encrypt and decrypt a string. The security of the encrypted string depends on maintaining the secrecy of the key. Uses an XOR-based algorithm that uses a pseudo-random 32-bit key, based on a seed passed by the user as a function parameter.

name: String
help: String to encrypt.

name: key
help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

name: algorithm
help: The algorithm to use to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

name: encoding
help: The binary encoding used to represent the data as a string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * Base64: the Base64 algorithm, as specified by IETF RFC 2045. * Hex: the characters A-F and 0-9 represent the hexadecimal byte values. * UU: the UNIX standard UUEncode algorithm (default). If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter.

name: ivorsalt
help: Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

name: iterations
help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

name: encryptBinary
help: Encrypts binary data using a specific algorithm and encoding method.

name: bytes
help: Bindary data to encrypt.

name: key
help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

name: algorithm
help: The algorithm to use to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

name: ivorsalt

name: iterations

If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

name: evaluate
help: Evaluates one or more string expressions, dynamically, from left to right. (The results of an evaluation on the left can have meaning in an expression to the right.) Returns the result of evaluating the rightmost expression.

name: exp
help: Calculates the exponent whose base is e that represents number. The constant e equals 2.71828182845904, the base of the natural logarithm. This function is the inverse of Log, the natural logarithm of number.

name: expandPath
help: Creates an absolute, platform-appropriate path that is equivalent to the value of relative_path, appended to the base path. This function (despite its name) can accept an absolute or relative path in the relative_path attribute

name: fileExists
help: Determines whether a file exists

name: fileIsEOF
help: Determines whether ColdFusion has reached the end of the file while reading it.

name: fileObject
help: The file object.

name: find
help: Finds the first occurrence of a substring in a string, from a specified start position. The search is case-sensitive.

name: findNoCase
help: Finds the first occurrence of a substring in a string, from a specified start position. If substring is not in string, returns zero. The search is case-insensitive.

name: findOneOf
help: Finds the first occurrence of any one of a set of characters in a string, from a specified start position. The search is case-sensitive.

name: firstDayOfMonth
help: Determines the ordinal (day number, in the year) of the first day of the month in which a given date falls.

name: fix
help: Converts a real number to an integer.

name: formatBaseN
help: String Converts number to a string, in the base specified by radix. For example: #FormatBaseN(1024,16)#

name: generateSecretKey
help: Gets a secure key value for use in the encrypt function.

name: getAuthUser
help: Gets the name of an authenticated user.

name: getBaseTagData
help: Used within a custom tag. Finds calling (ancestor) tag by name and accesses its data.

name: getBaseTagList
help: Gets ancestor tag names, starting with the parent tag.

name: getBaseTemplatePath
help: Gets the absolute path of an application's base page.

name: getClientVariablesList
help: Finds the client variables to which a page has write access. Comma-delimited list of non-read-only client variables

name: getComponentMetadata
help: Gets metadata (such as the functions and implemented interfaces of a component) for a CFC or ColdFusion interface.

name: path
help: The dot-delimited path of the interface or CFC definition.

name: getContextRoot
help: Returns path to the J2EE server context root for the current request.

name: getCurrentTemplatePath
help: Gets the absolute path of the page that calls this function.

name: getDirectoryFromPath
help: Extracts a directory from an absolute path. Returns the absolute path, without the filename.

name: getEncoding
help: Returns the encoding (character set) of the Form or URL scope.

name: getException
help: Used with the cftry and cfcatch tags. Retrieves a Java exception object from a Java object.

name: getFileFromPath
help: Extracts a filename from an absolute path.

name: getFunctionList
help: Displays a list of the functions that are available in CFML.

name: getGatewayHelper
help: Gets a Java GatewayHelper object that provides methods and properties for use with a ColdFusion event gateway.

name: gatewayID
help: Identifier of the gateway that provides the GatewayHelper object.

name: getHTTPRequestData
help: Makes HTTP request headers and body available to CFML pages. Useful for capturing SOAP request data, which can be delivered in an HTTP header.

name: getHTTPTimeString
help: Gets the current time, in the Universal Time code (UTC).

name: getLocale
help: Gets the current geographic/language locale value. To set the default display format of date, time, number, and currency values in a CFML application session, you use the SetLocale function.

name: getLocaleDisplayName
help: Gets a locale value and displays the name in a manner that is appropriate to a specific locale. By default, gets the current locale in the current locale's language.

name: getLocalhostIP
help: Returns the localhost IP address, which is 127.0.0.1 for IPv4 and ::1 for IPv6 addresses.

name: getMetadata
help: Gets metadata (the methods, properties, and parameters of a component) associated with an object that is deployed on the CFML server.

name: getMetricData
help: Gets server performance metrics [mode - quicky] perf_monitor - Returns internal data, in a structure. simple_load - Returns an integer value that is computed from the state of the server's internal queues. Indicates the overall server load. prev_req_time - Returns the time, in milliseconds, that it took the server to process the previous request. avg_req_time - Returns the average time, in milliseconds, that it takes the server to process a request.

name: getPageContext
help: Gets the current CFML MX PageContext object that provides access to page attributes and configuration, request and response objects.

name: getProfileSections
help: Gets all the sections of an initialization file. An initialization file, as a struct whose format is as follows: - Each initialization file section name is a key in the struct - Each list of entries in a section of an initialization file is a value in the struct

name: getProfileString
help: Gets an initialization file entry. An initialization file assigns values to configuration variables, also known as entries, that are set when the system boots, the operating system comes up, or an application starts. Returns the entry - if no value, returns an empty string.

name: getSOAPRequest
help: Returns an XML object that contains the entire SOAP request. Usually called from within a web service CFC.

name: getSOAPRequestHeader
help: Obtains a SOAP request header. Call only from within a CFC web service function that is processing a request as a SOAP web service.

name: namespace
help: A String that is the namespace for the header

name: name
help: A String that is the name of the header

name: asXML
help: If True, the header is returned as a CFML XML object; if false (default), the header is returned as a Java object.

name: getSOAPResponse
help: Returns an XML object that contains the entire SOAP response after invoking a web service.

name: webservice
help: A webservice object as returned from the cfobject tag or the CreateObject function.

name: getSOAPResponseHeader
help: Returns a SOAP response header. Call this function from within code that is invoking a web service after making a web service request.

name: webservice
help: A webservice object as returned from the cfobject tag or the Createobject function.

name: namespace
help: A String that is the namespace for the header.

name: name
help: A String that is the name of the SOAP header.

name: asXML
help: If True, the header is returned as a CFML XML object; if false (default), the header is returned as a Java object.

name: getTempDirectory
help: Gets the path of the directory that CFML uses for temporary files. Before using this function in an application, test to determine the directory it returns under your account. Returns the absolute pathname of a directory, including a trailing slash.

name: getTempFile
help: Creates a temporary file in a directory whose name starts with (at most) the first three characters of prefix.

name: getTemplatePath
help: This function is deprecated.  Use the GetBaseTemplatePath function instead.

name: getTickCount
help: Returns the current value of an internal millisecond timer.

name: getTimezoneInfo
help: Gets local time zone information for the computer on which it is called, relative to Universal Time Coordinated (UTC). UTC is the mean solar time of the meridian of Greenwich, England.

name: getToken
help: Determines whether a token of the list in the delimiters parameter is present in a string. Returns the token found at position index of the string, as a string. If index is greater than the number of tokens in the string, returns an empty string.

name: getUserRoles
help: Retrieves the list of roles for the current user.

name: getVFSMetadata
help: Returns metadata for VFS

name: hash
help: Converts a variable-length string to a 32-byte, hexadecimal string, using the MD5 algorithm. (It is not possible to convert the hash result back to the source string.) 32-byte, hexadecimal string

name: encoding
help: A string specifying the encoding to use when converting the string to byte data used by the hash algorithm. Must be a character encoding name recognized by the Java runtime.

name: hour
help: Gets the current hour of the day. Ordinal value of the hour, in the range 0 - 23.

help._: Replaces special characters in a string with their HTML-escaped equivalents and inserts  tags at the beginning and end of the string. [version] HTML version to use. currently ignored. -1: The latest implementation of HTML 2.0: HTML 2.0 (Default) 3.2: HTML 3.2

name: htmlEditFormat
help: Replaces special characters in a string with their HTML-escaped equivalents. [version] HTML version to use. currently ignored. -1: The latest implementation of HTML 2.0: HTML 2.0 (Default) 3.2: HTML 3.2

name: iIf
help: Evaluates a Boolean conditional dynamic expression. Depending on whether the expression is true or false, dynamically evaluates one of two string expressions and returns the result.

name: incrementValue
help: Adds one to an integer. same as x=x+1 Why bother?

name: inputBaseN
help: Converts string, using the base specified by radix, to an integer. For example: #InputBaseN("3ff",16)#

name: insert
help: Inserts a substring in a string after a specified character position. If position = 0, prefixes the substring to the string.

name: int
help: Calculates the closest integer that is smaller than number.

name: isArray
help: Determines whether a value is an array. True, if value is an array, a query column object, or xml. also number = Dimension; function tests whether the array has exactly this dimension

name: isBinary
help: Determines whether a value is stored as binary data.

name: isBoolean
help: Determines whether a value can be converted to Boolean

name: isCustomFunction
help: Determines whether a name represents a custom function

name: isDate
help: Determines whether a string or Java object can be converted to a date/time value.

name: isDDX
help: Determines whether a DDX file exists and is valid, or if a string contains valid DDX instructions.

name: path
help: Pathname to the DDX file or a string of DDX instructions.

name: isDebugMode
help: Determines whether debugging output is enabled.

name: isInstanceOf
help: Determines whether an object is an instance of a Coldfusion interface or component, or of a Java class.

name: object
help: The CFC instance or Java object that you are testing

name: typename
help: The name of the interface, component, or Java class of which the object might be an instance

name: isJSON
help: Evaluates whether a string is in valid JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) data interchange format.

name: var
help: A string or variable that represents one.

name: isDefined
help: Evaluates a string value to determine whether the variable named in it exists.

name: isLeapYear
help: Determines whether a year is a leap year.

name: isLocalhost
help: Determines whether the specified IP address is the localhost.

name: ipaddress
help: Valid IP address.

name: isNumeric
help: Determines whether a string can be converted to a numeric value. Supports numbers in U.S. number format. For other number support use LSIsNumeric.

name: isNumericDate
help: Evaluates whether a real number is a valid representation of a date (date/time object).

name: isObject
help: Determines whether a value is an object. True, if the value represents a CFML object. False if the value is any other type of data, such as an integer, string, date, or struct.

name: isPDFFile
help: Verifies whether a PDF file is valid.

name: path
help: Pathname to a PDF file.

name: isPDFObject
help: Determines whether a value is a PDF object.

name: value
help: A value, typically the PDF object stored as a variable name.

name: isQuery
help: Determines whether value is a query.

name: isSimpleValue
help: Determines the type of a value.

name: isSOAPRequest
help: Determines whether a CFC is being called as a web service.

name: isStruct
help: Determines whether a variable is a structure. True, if variable is a CFML structure or is a Java object that implements the java.lang.Map interface. Returns False if the object in variable is a user-defined function (UDF).

name: isUserInRole
help: Determines whether an authenticated user belongs to the specified Role.

name: isUserLoggedIn
help: Determines whether a user is logged in.

name: isValid
help: Tests whether a value meets a validation or data type rule.

name: type
help: The valid format for the data.

name: value
help: The value to test.

name: min
help: The minimum valid value; used only for range validation.

name: max
help: The maximum valid value; used only for range validation.

name: pattern
help: A regular expression that the parameter must match; used only for regex or regular_expression validation.

name: isWDDX
help: Determines whether a value is a well-formed WDDX packet.

name: isXML
help: Determines whether a string is well-formed XML text.

name: value
help: A string containing the XML document text.

name: isXMLAttribute
help: Determines whether the function parameter is an XML Document Object Model (DOM) attribute node.

name: value
help: Name of an XML attribute.

name: isXMLDoc
help: Determines whether a function parameter is an Extended Markup language (XML) document object.

name: isXMLElem
help: Determines whether a function parameter is an Extended Markup language (XML) document object element.

name: isXMLNode
help: Determines whether the function parameter is an XML document object node.

name: value
help: Name of an XML document object node.

name: isXMLRoot
help: Determines whether a function parameter is the root element of an Extended Markup language (XML) document object.

name: javacast
help: Converts the data type of a CFML variable to pass as an argument to an overloaded method of a Java object. Use only for scalar and string arguments. [type - quicky] boolean,int,long,float,double,string

name: jsStringFormat
help: Escapes special JavaScript characters, such as single quotation mark, double quotation mark, and newline

name: lCase
help: Converts the alphabetic characters in a string to lowercase.

name: left
help: Returns the leftmost count characters in a string.

name: len
help: Determines the length of a string or binary object

name: listAppend
help: Concatenates a list or element to a list.

name: value
help: An element or a list of elements.

name: listChangeDelims
help: Changes a list delimiter. Returns a copy of the list, with each delimiter character replaced by new_delimiter.

name: listContains
help: Determines the index of the first list element that contains a specified substring. Returns the index of the first list element that contains substring. If not found, returns zero.

name: listContainsNoCase
help: Determines the index of the first list element that contains a specified substring.

name: listDeleteAt
help: Deletes an element from a list. Returns a copy of the list, without the specified element.

name: listFind
help: Determines the index of the first list element in which a specified value occurs. Case-sensitive

name: listFindNoCase
help: Determines the index of the first list element in which a specified value occurs

name: listFirst
help: Gets the first element of a list.

name: listGetAt
help: Gets a list element at a specified position.

name: listInsertAt
help: Inserts an element in a list.

name: listLast
help: Gets the last element of a list.

name: listLen
help: Determines the number of elements in a list.

name: listPrepend
help: Inserts an element at the beginning of a list.

name: listQualify
help: Inserts a string at the beginning and end of list elements.

name: listRest
help: Gets a list, without its first element.

name: listSetAt
help: Replaces the contents of a list element.

name: listSort
help: Sorts list elements according to a sort type and sort order. Returns a sorted copy of the list. [sort_type - quicky] numeric: sorts numbers text: sorts text alphabetically, taking case into account - aabzABZ, if sort_order = "asc" - ZBAzbaa, if sort_order = "desc" textnocase: sorts text alphabetically, without regard to case - aAaBbBzzZ, in an asc sort; - ZzzBbBaAa, in a desc sort;

name: localSensitive
help: Performs locale sensitive sort, if tyue. Default is false

name: listToArray
help: Copies the elements of a list to an array.

name: includeEmptyFields
help: A Boolean value specifying whether to create empty array entries if there are two delimiters in a row.

name: multiCharacterDelimiter
help: A Boolean value specifying whether the delimiters parameter specifies a multi-character delimiter.

name: listValueCount
help: Counts instances of a specified value in a list. The search is case-sensitive.

name: listValueCountNoCase
help: Counts instances of a specified value in a list. The search is case-insensitive.

name: lJustify
help: Left justifies characters in a string of a specified length.

name: location
help: Stops execution of the current page and opens a CFML page or HTML file.

name: url
help: URL of HTML file or CFML page to open.

name: addtoken
help: ClientManagement must be enabled (see cfapplication).

name: statuscode
help: The HTTP status code

name: log
help: Calculates the natural logarithm of a number. Natural logarithms are based on the constant e (2.71828182845904).

name: log10
help: Calculates the logarithm of number, to base 10.

name: lsCurrencyFormat
help: Formats a number in a locale-specific currency format. For countries that use the euro, the result depends on the JVM. [type - quicky] local: the currency format and currency symbol used locally. - With JDK 1.3, the default for Euro Zone: local currency. - With JDK 1.4, the default for Euro Zone: euro. international: the international standard currency format none: the local currency format; no currency symbol

name: lsDateFormat
help: Formats the date part of a date/time value in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] d,dd,ddd,dddd: Day of month / week m,mm,mmm,mmmm: Month; y,yy,yyyy: Year; gg: Period/era string short / medium / long / full

name: lsEuroCurrencyFormat
help: Formats a number in a locale-specific currency format. [type - quicky] local: the currency format used in the locale. (Default.) international: the international standard currency format none: the currency format used; no currency symbol

name: lsIsCurrency
help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a currency amount in the current locale.

name: lsIsDate
help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a date/time value in the current locale.

name: lsIsNumeric
help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a number in the current locale.

name: isNull
help: Determines whether given object is null or not

name: lsNumberFormat
help: Formats a number in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] _,9 Digit placeholder; . decimal point; 0 Pads with zeros; ( ) less than zero, puts parentheses around the mask + plus sign before positive number minus before negative - a space before positive minus sign before negative , Separates every third decimal place with a comma. L,C Left-justifies or center-justifies number $ dollar sign before formatted number. ^ Separates left and right formatting.

name: locale
help: Locale to be used for formatting

name: lsParseCurrency
help: Converts a locale-specific currency string into a formatted number. Attempts conversion by comparing the string with each the three supported currency formats (none, local, international) and using the first that matches.

name: lsParseDateTime
help: Converts a string that is a valid date/time representation in the current locale into a date/time object.

name: loc
help: Locale

name: format
help: Format for parsing the date, as supported in Java

name: lsParseEuroCurrency
help: Formats a locale-specific currency string as a number. Attempts conversion through each of the default currency formats (none, local, international). Ensures correct handling of euro currency for Euro zone countries.

name: lsParseNumber
help: Converts a string that is a valid numeric representation in the current locale into a formatted number.

name: lsTimeFormat
help: Formats the time part of a date/time string into a string in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] h,hh,H,HH: Hours; m,mm: Minutes; s,ss: Seconds; l: Milliseconds; t: A or P; tt: AM or PM "short" = h:mm tt; "medium" = h:mm:ss tt

name: lTrim
help: Removes leading spaces from a string.

name: max
help: Determines the greater of two numbers.

name: mid
help: Extracts a substring from a string.

name: String
help: The string from which the substring will be extracted.

name: start
help: The position of the first character to retrieve.

name: count
help: The number of characters to retrieve.

name: min
help: Determines the lesser of two numbers.

name: minute
help: Extracts the minute value from a date/time object.

name: month
help: Extracts the month value from a date/time object.

name: monthAsString
help: Determines the name of the month that corresponds to month_number.

name: month_number
help: An integer in the range 1 – 12.

name: locale
help: Locale to use instead of the locale of the page when processing the function

name: now
help: Gets the current date and time of the computer running the CFML server.

name: numberFormat
help: Creates a custom-formatted number value. For international number formatting use LSNumberFormat. [mask - quicky] _,9 Digit placeholder; . decimal point; 0 Pads with zeros; ( ) less than zero, puts parentheses around the mask + plus sign before positive number minus before negative - a space before positive minus sign before negative , Separates every third decimal place with a comma. L,C Left-justifies or center-justifies number $ dollar sign before formatted number. ^ Separates left and right formatting.

name: paragraphFormat
help:
Replaces characters in a string: * Single newline characters (CR/LF sequences) with spaces * Double newline characters with HTML paragraph tags (

)

name: parseDateTime
help: Parses a date/time string according to the English (U.S.) locale conventions. (To format a date/time string for other locales, use the LSParseDateTime function.)

name: styleOrFormat
help: - standard: (the default) function does no conversion. - pop: specifies that the date/time string is in POP format, which includes the local time of the sender and a time-zone offset from UTC. ColdFusion applies the offset and returns a value with the UTC time. - Or custom Date format as supported in Java

name: pi
help: Gets the mathematical constant p, accurate to 15 digits. The number 3.14159265358979.

name: precisionEvaluate
help: Evaluates one or more string expressions.

name: expressions
help: Expressions to evaluate

name: preserveSingleQuotes
help: Prevents CFML from automatically escaping single quotation mark characters that are contained in a variable. CFML does not evaluate the argument.  Note: ColdFusion automatically escapes simple-variable, array-variable, and structure-variable references within a cfquery tag body or block.

name: variable
help: Variable that contains a string in which to preserve single quotation marks.

name: quarter
help: Calculates the quarter of the year in which a date falls.

name: queryAddColumn
help: Adds a column to a query and populates its rows with the contents of a one-dimensional array. Pads query columns, if necessary, to ensure that all columns have the same number of rows.

name: datatype
help: Column data type.

name: queryAddRow
help: Adds a specified number of empty rows to a query.

name: rowData
help: Could be numeric, Struct or array of Struct

name: queryNew
help: Creates an empty query (query object).

name: columnlist
help: A string or a variable that contains one. Delimited list of column names, or an empty string.

name: columntypelist
help: Comma-delimited list specifying column data types.

name: rowData
help: Row data as Struct or array of Struct

name: querySetCell
help: Sets a cell to a value. If no row number is specified, the cell on the last row is set.

name: quotedValueList
help: Gets the values of each record returned from an executed query. CFML does not evaluate the arguments

name: rand
help: Generates a pseudo-random number in the range 0 - 1.

name: algorithm
help: The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

name: randomize
help: Seeds the pseudo-random number generator with an integer number, ensuring repeatable number patterns.

name: algorithm
help: The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

name: randRange
help: Generates a random integer between two specified numbers. Requests for random integers that are greater than 100,000,000 result in non-random numbers, to prevent overflow during internal computations.

name: algorithm
help: The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

name: reFind
help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern. The search is case sensitive.

name: reg_expression
help: Regular expression for which to search. Case sensitive.

name: String
help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

name: start
help: A positive integer, or a variable that contains one. Position in the string at which to start search. The default value is 1.

name: returnsubexpressions
help: True: if the regular expression is found, the first array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first match. If the regular expression contains parentheses that group subexpressions, each subsequent array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first occurrence of each group. If the regular expression is not found, the arrays each contain one element with the value 0. False: the function returns the position in the string where the match begins. Default.

name: reFindNoCase
help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position. The search is case-insensitive.

name: String
help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

name: returnsubexpressions
help: True: if the regular expression is found, the first array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first match. If the regular expression contains parentheses that group subexpressions, each subsequent array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first occurrence of each group. If the regular expression is not found, the arrays each contain one element with the value 0. False: the function returns the position in the string where the match begins. Default.

name: reMatch
help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position.

name: reg_expression
help: Regular expression for which to search. Case sensitive.

name: string
help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

name: reMatchNoCase
help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position.

name: reg_expression
help: Regular expression for which to search. Case insensitive.

name: string
help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

name: releaseCOMObject
help: Releases a COM Object and frees up resources that it used.

name: removeChars
help: Removes characters from a string.

name: repeatString
help: Creates a string that contains a specified number of repetitions of the specified string.

name: replace
help: Replaces occurrences of substring1 in a string with substring2, in a specified scope. The search is case-sensitive.

name: scope
help: * one: replace the first occurrence (default) * all: replace all occurrences

name: replaceList
help: Replaces occurrences of the elements from a delimited list in a string with corresponding elements from another delimited list. The search is case sensitive.

name: delimiter1

name: delimiter2

name: replaceNoCase

name: scope
help: * one: Replace the first occurrence (default) * all: Replace all occurrences

help: A string or a variable that contains one

name: reg_expression

name: substring

name: reReplaceNoCase
help: Uses a regular expression to search a string for a string pattern and replace it with another. The search is case-insensitive.

name: String
help: A string or a variable that contains one

name: reg_expression
help: Regular expression to replace.

name: substring
help: A string or a variable that contains one. Replaces reg_expression

name: scope
help: * one: Replace the first occurrence of the regular expression. Default. * all: Replace all occurrences of the regular expression.

name: String

name: rJustify

name: round

name: rTrim

name: String
help: A string or a variable that contains one

name: second

name: date
help: A date/time object

name: sendGatewayMessage

name: gatewayID

name: data
help: A ColdFusion structure.

name: serializeJSON

name: obj
help: A ColdFusion data value or variable that represents one.

help: How to serialize ColdFusion queries.

name: secure
help: No Help Available.

name: usecustomserializer

name: usecustomserializer
help: Whether to use the customSerializer or not. The default value is true. Always the custom serializer will be used for serialization. If specified false, the XML serialization will be done using the default ColdFusion behaviour

name: value

name: autogenmap
help: autogenmap=true|false - Specifies whether ColdFusion should automatically generate mapping for the persistent CFCs. If autogenmap=false, mapping should be provided in the form of .HBMXML files.

name: cacheconfig
help: Specifies the location of the configuration file that should be used by the secondary cache provider.This setting is used only when secondarycacheenabled=true.

name: cacheprovider
help: Specifies the cache provider that should be used by ORM as secondary cache. The values can be: 						    * Ehcache 						    * JBossCache 						    * Hashtable 						    * SwarmCache 						    * OSCache  Fully qualified name of the class for any other cache provider.  This setting is used only when secondarycacheenabled=true

name: catalog
help: Specifies the default Catalog that should be used by ORM.

name: cfclocation
help: Specifies the directory (or array of directories) that should be used by ColdFusion to search for persistent CFCs to generate the mapping. If cfclocation is set, ColdFusion looks at only the paths specified in it. If it is not set, ColdFusion looks at the application directory, its sub-directories, and its mapped directories to search for persistent CFCs.

name: datasource
help: Specifies the data source that should be used by ORM. If it is not specified here, then the data source specified for the application is picked up.

name: dbcreate
help: ColdFusion ORM can automatically create the tables for your application in the database when ORM is initialized for the application. This can be enabled by using dbcreate in ormsettings. dbCreate takes the following values: 						    * update: Setting this value creates the table if it does not exist or update the table if it exists. * dropcreate: Setting this value drops the table if it exists and then creates it. * none (default): Setting this value does not change anything in the database schema.

name: dialect
help: Specifies the dialect.

name: eventHandling

name: logSQL

name: ormconfig

name: useDBForMapping
help: useDBForMapping=true|false - Specifies whether the database has to be inspected to identify the missing information required to generate the Hibernate mapping. The database is inspected to get the column data type, primary key and foreign key information.

name: skipCFCWithError

Contains a tab-separated list of the actual temporary filenames written to the server. (only when action="getall")
Body of message. (only when action="getall")
Text Body of message. (only when action="getall")
HTML Body of message. (only when action="getall")
CC value from message header.
Date sent value from message header.
From value from message header.
Entire message header. (only when action="getall")
Sequential message number of message on POP server.
The mail header Message-ID field.
ReplyTo value from message header.
Subject value from message header.
To value from message header.
Column list, comma seperated.
The current row of the query in a loop.
Total number of records in the query.
Unique identifier for the e-mail message file. (mail header X-UID field)

Structure that contains key-value pairs. The keys are the names of image files that are embedded in the e-mail message; the values are their cids. You can use the cid to find the correct place of an image in an HTML e-mail message that the cfpop tag retrieves. If the e-mail message contains more than one embedded image, only the last embedded image is available.
The SQL statement that was executed.
If the query was cached.
An ordered Array of cfqueryparam values.
Total number of records in the query.
Column list, comma seperated.
Execution time for the SQL request.
The current row of the query in a loop.
Total number of records in the query.
Column list, comma seperated.
Response character character set (character encoding) specified by the response Content-Type header.

If the connection to the HTTP server fails, contains details about the failure. For instance: "Unknown host: my.co.com"; otherwise, the empty string. Macromedia recommends that you check this variable for an error condition before checking other variables.
Response body; for example: the contents of a html page retrieved by a GET operation. Empty if you save the response in a file.
Raw response header containing all header information in a single string. Contains the same information as the #cfhttp.responseHeader# variable.
MIME type specified by the response Content-Type header, Example: text/html

The response headers formatted into a structure. Each element key is the header name, such as Content-Type or Status_Code. If there is more than one instance of a header type, the type values are put in an array. One common technique is to dynamically access the cfhttp.responseHeader structure as a dynamic array, example: #cfhttp.resonseHeader[fieldVariable]#
The HTTP status_code header value followed by the HTTP Explanation header value. Example: 200 OK

Boolean; True if the response body content type is text. ColdFusion recognizes the response body as text if: The header does not specify a content type, or it starts with "text" or "message" or the full content type="application/octet-stream".
All HTTP headers that were not already parsed into one of the listed variables. These variables are of the form HTTP_header field name with each variable separated by a semi-colon

(IIS) Retrieves all headers in raw form. The difference between CGI.ALL_RAW and CGI.ALL_HTTP is that CGI.ALL_HTTP places an HTTP_ prefix before the header name and the header name is always capitalized. In ALL_RAW the header name and values appear as they are sent by the client.

(IIS) Returns the name of the application pool that is running in the IIS worker process that is handling the request. There is also an CGI.APP_POOL_ID environment variable that is available to applications that are running in the IIS worker process. (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)
(IIS) Retrieves the metabase path of the application.
(IIS) Retrieves the physical path corresponding to the metabase path in CGI.APPL_MD_PATH.
(IIS) The value entered in the client's authentication dialog. This variable is available only if Basic authentication is used.
If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, this is the protocol-specific authentication method used to validate the user.

(IIS) The name of the user as it is derived from the authorization header sent by the client, before the user name is mapped to a Windows account. This variable is no different from CGI.REMOTE_USER. If you have an authentication filter installed on your Web server that maps incoming users to accounts, use CGI.LOGON_USER to view the mapped user name.
(IIS) Returns the full URL Example: http://www.macromedia.com:80/index.cfm?query=string (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)
(IIS) Unique ID for the client certificate, returned as a string. This can be used as a signature for the whole client certificate.

(IIS) bit0 is set to 1 if the client certificate is present. bit1 is set to 1 if the certification authority of the client certificate is invalid (that is, it is not in the list of recognized certification authorities on the server). If bit 1 of CGI.CERT_FLAGS is set to 1, indicating that the certificate is invalid, IIS version 4.0 and later will reject the certificate. (Note: Earlier versions of IIS will not reject the certificate.)
Issuer field of the client certificate (O=MS, OU=IAS, CN=user name, C=USA).
(IIS) Number of bits in the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) connection key size. Example: 128
(IIS) Number of bits in server certificate private key. Example: 1024
(IIS) Serial number field of the client certificate.
(IIS) Issuer field of the server certificate.
(IIS) Subject field of the server certificate.
Subject field of the client certificate.
Show the entire file path to the coldfusion template, similar to CGI.PATH_TRANSLATED. Example: c:\inetpub\wwwroot\somesite\somepage.cfm
The length of the content as given by the client.
For queries that have attached information, such as HTTP POST and PUT, this is the content type of the data.
(Apache SSI) The current date and time in Greenwich Mean Time (now Unviversal Co-ordinated Time (UCT) in the default or #config defined format). Thursday, 03-May-2001 21:18:54 GMT
(Apache SSI) The current date and time in the local (server) timezone (in the default or #config defined format), Example: Thursday, 03-May-2001 17:18:54 EDT

(Zeus SSI) This will be set to the CGI.QUERY_STRING of the master document. The value of CGI.QUERY_STRING for an SSI sub-request will contain the query string in the sub-request URL, if present, else the master document's CGI.QUERY_STRING.
(Apache SSI) The file name (excludes directories) of the document requested by the user. Example: ssi.htm
(Apache SSI/Zeus SSI) This will be set to the CGI.PATH_INFO of the master document.
(Apache SSI) The root directory of this site defined by the 'DocumentRoot' directive in the General Section or a <virtualhost> section. Example: /var/www/zytrax
(Apache SSI/Zeus SSI) The URL path of the document requested by the user. Example: /tech/web/ssi.htm
The revision of the CGI specification to which this server complies. Format: CGI/revision.
List of Content-types the browser can accept (defined by the HTTP Accept header).
(IIS) Returns a list of accepted encoding types. Example: gzip, deflate
(IIS) Returns a string describing the language to use for displaying content.
(IIS) Returns a string describing the connection type. Example: Keep-Alive
(IIS) Returns the cookie string that was included with the request.
(IIS) Returns the name of the Web server. This may or may not be the same as CGI.SERVER_NAME depending on type of name resolution you are using on your Web server (IP address, host header).
(IIS) The method used to make the request (Note: same as CGI.REQUEST_METHOD).
The referring document. The document that linked to or submitted form data.
(IIS) Returns the raw, encoded URL. Example: /vdir/default.asp?querystring
The browser the client is currently using to send the request. Format: software/version library/version.
(IIS) The name and version of the request protocol (the raw form of CGI.SERVER_PROTOCOL).
(IIS/Zeus) Returns ON if the request came in through a secure channel; or it returns OFF, if the request is for an insecure channel. Example: SSL
(IIS/Zeus) Number of bits in the SSL connection key size. Example: 128
(IIS/Zeus) Number of bits in the server certificate private key. Example: 1024
(IIS) Issuer field of the server certificate.
(IIS) Subject field of the server certificate.
(Zeus SSI) The value of the session id used by the SSL session. This value is unique for each distinct SSL session

(IIS) The ID for the IIS instance in textual format. If the instance ID is 1, it appears as a string. You can use this variable to retrieve the ID of the Web server instance (in the metabase) to which the request belongs.
(IIS) The metabase path for the instance of IIS that responds to the request.

(Apache SSI) The last modification date of the document (file) requested by the user (in the default or #config defined format). This variable related to the file currently being accessed i.e. if you put this is an included 'footer' file is is the modification date of the footer NOT the base document (you need to use a simple 'wheeze' to pass a USER variable which contains the calling documents modification date (see here). Example: Thursday, 03-May-2001 17:18:45 EDT

(IIS) Returns the server address on which the request came in. This is important on computers where there can be multiple IP addresses bound to the computer, and you want to find out which address the request used.

(IIS) The Windows account that the user is impersonating while connected to your Web server. Use CGI.REMOTE_USER, CGI.UNMAPPED_REMOTE_USER, or CGI.AUTH_USER to view the raw user name that is contained in the request header. The only time CGI.LOGON_USER holds a different value than these other variables is if you have an authentication filter installed.
(Apache) The PATH(s) available to the server for this web site Example: /sbin:/usr/sbin:/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/X11R6/bin

The extra path information, as given by the client. In other words, scripts can be accessed by their virtual pathname, followed by extra information at the end of this path. The extra information is sent as CGI.PATH_INFO.
The server provides a translated version of CGI.PATH_INFO, which takes the path and does any virtual-to-physical mapping to it.
The query information that follows the ? in the URL that referenced this script.
The IP address of the remote host making the request.
The hostname making the request. If the server does not have this information, it sets CGI.REMOTE_ADDR and leaves this unset.
If the HTTP server supports RFC 931 identification, then this variable is set to the remote user name retrieved from the server. Usage of this variable should be limited to logging only.
(IIS) The client port number of the TCP connection.
If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, this is the username they have authenticated as. (Also available as CGI.AUTH_USER.)
The entity body (if any) sent with an HTTP request or response is in a format and encoding defined by the Entity-Header fields. See the HTTP protocol specification for details.
The method with which the request was made. For HTTP, this "GET", "HEAD", "POST", etc.
(Apache) The URI for this request (relative to CGI.DOCUMENT_ROOT) Example: /tech/web/ssi.htm
(Apache) The path to the script being executed (relative to CGI.DOCUMENT_ROOT) Example: /tech/web/ssi.htm
A virtual path to the script being executed, used for self-referencing URLs.
(IIS) The canonical physical path to the script listed in CGI.SCRIPT_NAME Example: \\?\c:\inetpub\wwwroot\vdir\default.asp (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)
(Apache) The administrators e-mail address for this CGI.SERVER_NAME. Example: webmaster@zytrax.com
The servers hostname, DNS alias, or IP address as it appears in self-referencing URLs.
The port number to which the request was sent.
(IIS) A string that contains either 0 or 1. If the request is being handled on the secure port, then this is 1. Otherwise, it is 0.
The name and revision of the information protocol this request came in with. Format: protocol/revision.

help._: (Apache) The HTML string that may be embedded in the page to identify this host. Example:

help: The name and version of the information server software answering the request (and running the gateway). Format: name/version.

(IIS) Returns a 1 if the server-side include directive, #exec, is disabled. Otherwise, CGI.SSI_EXE_DISABLED returns a 0. To enable or disable #exec, use the SSIExecDisablemetabase property. (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)
(IIS) Returns the raw, unencoded URL Example: /vdir/default.asp?querystring (Note: IIS 4.0 and earlier: This server variable is not available)

(IIS) The name of the user as it is derived from the authorization header sent by the client, before the user name is mapped to a Windows account (same as CGI.REMOTE_USER). If you have an authentication filter installed on your Web server that maps incoming users to accounts, use CGI.LOGON_USER to view the mapped user name.
(IIS) Gives the base portion of the URL, without any querystring or extra path information. For the raw URL, use CGI.HTTP_URL or CGI.UNENCODED_URL. Example: "/vdir/default.asp".
(IIS) Use CGI.PATH_INFO instead. (Note: This server variable is only available on IIS 5.0.)
(Apache SSI) The user name of the web site in which this web site runs. Example: zytrax
The exception's type, possible values: Application, Database, Template, Security, Object, MissingInclude, Expression, Lock, SearchEngine or a Custom Type.
A detailed message from the CFML compiler. This message, which can contain HTML formatting, can help to determine which tag threw the exception.

The cfthrow tag can supply a value for this code through the errorCode attribute. For Type="Database", CFCATCH.ErrorCode has the same value as CFCATCH.SQLState. Otherwise, the value of CFCATCH.ErrorCode is the empty string.
Custom error message information. This is returned only to CFCATCH tags for which the type attribute is "Application" or a custom type. Otherwise, the value of CFCATCH.ExtendedInfo is empty.
The exception's default diagnostic message, if one was provided. If no diagnostic message is available, this is empty.
Array of tag information structures.
Obsolete (retained for backwards compatibility). Always 0.
The tag in which the exception occurred. Exceptions in CFScript are indicated by two question marks (??). All custom tags, including those called directly, are identified as cfmodule.
The line on the page in which the tag is located.
The raw Java stack trace for the error.
The pathname of the application page that contains the tag.
The type of page; it is always a ColdFusion page.
An internal expression error number. Available for expression exceptions.
The name of the affected lock. This is set to "anonymous" if the lock name is unknown. Available for locking exceptions.
The operation that failed. This is set to "unknown" if the failed operation is unknown. Available for locking exceptions.
The name of the missing file. Available for missingInclude exceptions.

The native error code associated with this exception. Database drivers typically provide error codes to assist in the diagnosis of failing database operations. The values assumed by CFCATCH.NativeErrorCode are driver-dependent. If no error code is provided, the value of CFCATCH.nativeErrorCode is -1. The value is 0 for queries of queries. Available for database exceptions.

The SQLState code associated with this exception. Database drivers typically provide error codes to assist in the diagnosis of failing database operations. SQLState codes are more consistent across database systems than native error codes. If the driver does not provide an SQLState value, the value of CFCATCH.SQLState is -1. Available for database exceptions.
The SQL statement sent to the data source. Available for database exceptions.
The error message as reported by the database driver. Available for database exceptions.
If the query uses the cfqueryparam tag, query parameter name-value pairs. Available for database exceptions.
Unordered list of validation errors that occurred. This includes any text that you specify in the value attribute or a hidden tag used to validate form input. Available for Validation type errors.
Text for the header of the default validation message. Available for Validation type errors.
Text for the footer of the default validation message. Available for Validation type errors.
Browser that was running when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
Date and time when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
Detailed error diagnostics. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
Any content that ColdFusion generated in response to the request prior to the error. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

Page containing the HTML link to the page on which the error occurred. This value is an empty string if the user specified the page directly in the browser. (string). Available for Exception and Request type errors
E-mail address of the administrator who should be notified. This value is set in the mailTo attribute of the cferror tag. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
URL query string of the client's request, if any. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
IP address of the remote client. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
Page being executed when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
Error message associated with the exception. Available for Exception type errors.
Java servlet exception reported by the JVM as the cause of the "root cause" of the exception. Available for Exception type errors.
Exception type, possible values: Application, Database, Template, Security, Object, MissingInclude, Expression, Lock, SearchEngine or a Custom Type.
Array of structures containing information for each tag in the tag stack The tag stack consists of each tag that is currently open. Available for Exception type errors.
Obsolete (retained for backwards compatibility). Always 0.
The tag in which the exception occurred. Exceptions in CFScript are indicated by two question marks (??). All custom tags, including those called directly, are identified as cfmodule.
The line on the page in which the tag is located. (int)
The raw Java stack trace for the error.
The pathname of the application page that contains the tag.
The type of page; it is always a ColdFusion page.
Unordered list of validation errors that occurred. This includes any text that you specify in the value attribute or a hidden tag used to validate form input. Available for Validation type errors.
Text for the header of the default validation message. Available for Validation type errors.
Text for the footer of the default validation message. Available for Validation type errors.
Browser that was running when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
Date and time when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
Detailed error diagnostics. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
Any content that ColdFusion generated in response to the request prior to the error. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

Page containing the HTML link to the page on which the error occurred. This value is an empty string if the user specified the page directly in the browser. (string). Available for Exception and Request type errors
E-mail address of the administrator who should be notified. This value is set in the mailTo attribute of the ERROR tag. Available for Exception and Request type errors.
URL query string of the client's request, if any. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

Page being executed when the error occurred. Available for Exception and Request type errors.

Java servlet exception reported by the JVM as the cause of the "root cause" of the exception. Available for Exception type errors.
Exception type, possible values: Application, Database, Template, Security, Object, MissingInclude, Expression, Lock, SearchEngine or a Custom Type.
Array of structures containing information for each tag in the tag stack The tag stack consists of each tag that is currently open. Available for Exception type errors.
Obsolete (retained for backwards compatibility). Always 0.
